name: v3.6.0-alpha.2
body:
This is a feature release of OpenShift Origin.

## Backwards Compatibility

- The experimental command `oc import docker-compose` has been removed [\#13795](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13795)
  - Work has moved to the [kompose project](http://kompose.io)
- The `status.unavailableReplicas` field on deployment configs no longer accepts negative numbers [\#14046](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/14046)
- The extended certificate validation feature in the router is now much stricter [\#13897](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13897)
  - In order to ensure that buggy, malicious, or invalid certificates cannot crash a router the extended certificate feature now decodes and then re-encodes certificates from routes. Only a known set of allowed PEM blocks and certificate types will be accepted, including the common RSA and ECSDA variants of both public and private keys.
  - If you are upgrading your cluster and have not disabled extended certification (on by default) you should start a test router instance and verify that all routes successfully load before completing your rollout.
  - Routes that fail extended validation are taken out of rotation and have a status field message set indicating they are not accepted.


## Changes

[Roadmap for the v3.6 release](https://ci.openshift.redhat.com/releases_overview.html#3.6)

[v3.6.0-alpha.2](https://github.com/openshift/origin/tree/v3.6.0-alpha.2) (2017-06-07) [Full Changelog](https://github.com/openshift/origin/compare/v3.6.0-alpha.1...v3.6.0-alpha.2)


## API

- Add fields to builds that display the status of build results [\#13307](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13307)
  - A series of stages and steps are part of build status and populated by the builder.
- Two fields are added to build config spec to control how many successful and failed builds are preserved on the cluster [\#13788](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13788)
- The `spec.tls.destinationCACertificate` field on a route is now optional - routers that don't allow defaulting will reject this route


### Component updates

- Updated to Kubernetes [v1.6.1-1-g5115d708d7 + patches](https://github.com/openshift/kubernetes/commits/010d313)
  - 39732: Fix issue #34242: Attach/detach should recover from a crash [\#14119](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/14119)
  - 40423: Support for v1/v2/autoprobe openstack cinder blockstorage [\#14005](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/14005)
  - 41498: cinder: Add support for the KVM virtio-scsi driver [\#14005](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/14005)
  - 41634: Handle error event type [\#13939](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13939)
  - 41939: Add an AEAD encrypting transformer for storing secrets encrypted at rest. [\#14243](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/14243)
  - 42033: fix TODO: find and add active pods for dswp [\#14119](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/14119)
  - 42672: use separate scheme to serve the kube-aggregator [\#13974](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13974)
  - 42801: add local option to APIService [\#13974](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13974)
  - 42886: allow fallthrough handling from go-restful routes [\#13974](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13974)
  - 42900: rewire aggregation handling chain to be normal [\#13974](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13974)
  - 42911: combine kube-apiserver and kube-aggregator [\#13974](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13974)
  - 43076: allow combining API servers [\#13974](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13974)
  - 43141: Create controller to auto register TPRs with the aggregator [\#13974](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13974)
  - 43144: start informers as a post-start-hook [\#13974](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13974)
  - 43149: break kube-apiserver start into stages [\#13974](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13974)
  - 43170: Add ability to customize fed namespace for e2e [\#14106](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/14106)
  - 43226: don't start controllers against unhealthy master [\#13974](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13974)
  - 43289: Attach/detach controller: fix potential race in constructor [\#14119](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/14119)
  - 43301: add APIService conditions [\#14285](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/14285)
  - 43375: Set permission for volume subPaths [\#13895](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13895)
  - 43377: only log stacks on server errors [\#14173](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/14173)
  - 43383: proxy to IP instead of name, but still use host verification [\#13974](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13974)
  - 43396: iSCSI CHAP support [\#14112](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/14112)
  - 43575: util/iptables: check for and use new iptables-restore 'wait' argument [\#14186](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/14186)
  - 43922: prevent corrupted spdy stream after hijacking connection [\#13669](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13669)
  - 43945: Remove 'beta' from default storage class annotation [\#14427](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/14427)
  - 44066: Improve federation e2e test setup [\#14106](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/14106)
  - 44068: Use Docker API Version instead of docker version (fixup) [\#14335](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/14335)
  - 44068: Use Docker API Version instead of docker version [\#14158](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/14158)
  - 44072: Cleanup e2e framework for federation [\#14106](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/14106)
  - 44073: Optionally retrieve fed e2e cluster config from secrets [\#14106](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/14106)
  - 44082: use AvailabilityZone instead of Availability [\#14005](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/14005)
  - 44221: validateClusterInfo: use clientcmdapi.NewCluster() [\#13653](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13653)
  - 44295: Azure disk: dealing with missing disk probe [\#14072](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/14072)
  - 44406: CRI: Stop following container log when container exited. [\#14380](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/14380)
  - 44439: controller: fix saturation check in Deployments [\#13890](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13890)
  - 44452: Implement LRU for AWS device allocator [\#14119](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/14119)
  - 44462: 44489: fix selfLink for cluster-scoped resources [\#14001](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/14001)
  - 44566: WaitForCacheSync before running attachdetach controller [\#14119](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/14119)
  - 44570: Explicit namespace from kubeconfig should override in-cluster config [\#13653](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13653)
  - 44625: Retry secret reference addition on conflict [\#14033](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/14033)
  - 44639: Set fed apiserver to bind to 8443 instead of 443 [\#14107](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/14107)
  - 44730: Check for terminating Pod prior to launching successor in StatefulSet [\#13653](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13653)
  - 44760: Fix issue #44757: Flaky Test_AttachDetachControllerRecovery [\#14119](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/14119)
  - 44781: Ensure desired state of world populator runs before volume reconstructor [\#14144](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/14144)
  - 44798: Cinder: Automatically Generate Zone if Availability in Storage Class is not Configured [\#14159](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/14159)
  - 44837: Fix Content-Type error of apis [\#14285](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/14285)
  - 44859: e2e: handle nil ReplicaSet in checkDeploymentRevision [\#13653](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13653)
  - 44861: NotRegisteredErr for known kinds not registered in target GV [\#13653](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13653)
  - 44895: util/iptables: grab iptables locks if iptables-restore doesn't support --wait [\#14186](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/14186)
  - 44939: don't HandleError on container start failure [\#14077](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/14077)
  - 44970: CRI: Fix StopContainer timeout [\#13938](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13938)
  - 45100: node-controller: deflake TestUpdateNodeWithMultiplePods [\#13940](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13940)
  - 45105: taint-controller-tests: double 'a bit of time' to avoid flakes [\#13953](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13953)
  - 45171: Use groupName comment for listers/informers [\#13982](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13982)
  - 45235: remove bearer token from headers after we consume it [\#14007](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/14007)
  - 45238: expose kubelet authentication and authorization builders [\#14011](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/14011)
  - 45286: When pods are terminated we should detach the volume [\#14191](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/14191)
  - 45304: increase the QPS for namespace controller [\#14274](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/14274)
  - 45403: apiserver: injectable default watch cache size [\#14052](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/14052)
  - 45413: Extend timeouts in timed_workers_test [\#14225](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/14225)
  - 45427: 45897: GC controller improvements [\#14358](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/14358)
  - 45496: fix pleg relist time [\#14282](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/14282)
  - 45505: expose the controller initializers [\#14033](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/14033)
  - 45515: Ignore openrc group [\#13964](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13964)
  - 45601: util/iptables: fix cross-build failures due to syscall.Flock() [\#14186](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/14186)
  - 45623: Don't attempt to make and chmod subPath if it already exists [\#14193](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/14193)
  - 45685: fix quota resync [\#14151](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/14151)
  - 45741: Fix discovery version for autoscaling to be v1 [\#14255](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/14255)
  - 45747: OwnerReferencesPermissionEnforcement ignores pods/status [\#14204](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/14204)
  - 45826: prevent pods/status from touching ownerreferences [\#14204](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/14204)
  - 45835: client-gen: honor groupName overrides in customArgs [\#14203](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/14203)
  - 45894: Export BaseControllerRefManager [\#14322](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/14322)
  - 45933: Use informers in scheduler / token controller (part 2, fixing tests) [\#14412](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/14412)
  - 45933: Use informers in scheduler / token controller [\#14321](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/14321)
  - 45940: apiserver: no Status in body for http 204 [\#14237](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/14237)

  - 46042: ResourceQuota admission control injects registry [\#14234](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/14234)
  - 46127: Return MethodNotSupported when accessing unwatcheable resource with ?watch=true [\#14260](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/14260)

  - 46751: Pre-generate SNI test certs [\#14412](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/14412)
  - Fix to avoid REST API calls at log level 2. [\#13844](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13844)
  - add OpenShift resources to garbage collector ignore list [\#13653](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13653)
  - openapi test, patch in updated package name [\#13653](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13653)
  - Set the log level for iptables rule dump to 5 [\#14359](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/14359)
  - disable apiserver loopback loop in generic context [\#13653](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13653)
  - kube-apiserver must not start aggregator [\#13974](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13974)
  - Integrate the kube-aggregator to support the service catalog [\#13974](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13974)
  - Consume the upstream authorizer [\#14006](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/14006)
  - Continue to support extensions/v1beta1 version of HorizontalPodAutoscaler [\#14021](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/14021)
- Updates to Docker distribution
  - docker/distribution: 1757: Export storage.CreateOptions in top-level package [\#13653](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13653)
  - docker/distribution: 1857: Provide stat descriptor for Create method during cross-repo mount [\#13653](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13653)
  - docker/distribution: 2008: Honor X-Forwarded-Port and Forwarded headers [\#13653](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13653)
  - docker/distribution: 2140: Add 'ca-central-1' region for registry S3 storage driver [\#13653](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13653)


### Features

#### Tech preview of cluster federation

Cluster workload federation is nearing beta status in Kubernetes and is now part of the OpenShift distribution.  The `kubefed` binary is built as part of Origin and will help stand up a tech preview cluster.

- Enable preliminary support for origin federation [\#14239](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/14239)


#### Simulate cluster capacity

The cluster capacity command emulates the Kubernetes scheduler for a set of pod workloads and estimates how many pods can be scheduled on a cluster.

- Add cluster capacity image to OpenShift [\#14258](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/14258)


#### Enable Garbage Collection on OpenShift resources

The [garbage collection feature in Kubernetes](https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/workloads/controllers/garbage-collection/) is now stable and enabled in OpenShift. OpenShift controllers like deployment configs, build configs, and templates set owner references on the objects they create, which means deleting a deployment config will now automatically clean up the replication controllers and pods created by the deployment. The web console uses owner information to better organize resources and can now delete resources when they have changed. See the documentation for more on how to leverage garbage collection to manage cleanup.

- Add DC controllerRef to RC [\#14322](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/14322)
- web: Bug 1449908 - Group replica sets by owner reference [\#1553](https://github.com/openshift/origin-web-console/pull/1553)
- web: Bug 1449949 - Group pods by owner reference [\#1538](https://github.com/openshift/origin-web-console/pull/1538)
- orphan resources by default for SOME resourced under /oapi [\#14134](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/14134)
- mark build->buildconfig ownerref as a controller [\#14250](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/14250)
- shared GC [\#14358](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/14358)


#### Improvements to network egress policy

This release improves egress network policy (handled by an egress router) to make managing traffic leaving namespaces easier via DNS name support on destinations and also targeting multiple destinations.

- sdn: Support DNS names for egress network policy [\#13002](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13002)
- egress: Allow multiple destinations in egress-router [\#13837](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13837)


#### Use git references like tags and GitHub/GitLab pull request links in builds

Git branches and tags are both represented as "references" inside of a repository. GitHub adds references in Git for each pull request, but to use that reference in an OpenShift build we must first `fetch` the
information from the remote server. The `ref` field on a build's Git source specification can now point
to any valid Git reference and OpenShift will attempt to retrieve that ref, allowing pull requests to
be spawned for a specific build. 

- builds: Allow the `ref` field on builds to point to any Git reference [\#13893](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13893)
- builds: Enable fetch from oc new-app, start-build, source lookup [\#14025](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/14025)
- builds: Fix overlap between branch and ref names [\#14103](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/14103)


#### Reference OpenShift image streams from Kubernetes resources

OpenShift image streams make it easy to decouple image management from deployment. Image streams can now be used directly from Kubernetes resources like StatefulSets, Jobs, CronJobs, Deployments, or  DaemonSets via the new `lookupPolicy` that has been added to image streams. The `oc set image-lookup`  command allows you to mark an image stream within your project as being a local reference:

```
$ oc import-image mysql:latest
$ oc set image-lookup mysql
```

Now you can reference the image `mysql:latest` from within a Kubernetes controller and the corresponding image stream tag will be used:

```
$ oc run --image=mysql:latest --restart=OnFailure myjob
$ oc get pods
```

The pod created by the job will use the image tagged as `latest` in the image stream `mysql`. Builds, pods, jobs, replicasets, and replication controllers will all respect these settings, and administrators can configure their image policy to add new resources.

- Extended test for local name resolution [\#13210](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13210)


#### Trigger updates to Kubernetes deployments and daemon sets on image change

The image trigger controller has been upgraded and now supports updating deployments, stateful sets, daemon sets, and cron jobs whenever an image stream tag is updated. A new alpha annotation can be set on the resource to describe which image stream tag should cause an update.

To update a DaemonSet whenever the image stream tag 'image:latest' in namespace 'namespace1' changes,  run:

```
$ oc set triggers daemonset/monitoring --from-image=namespace1/image:latest -c main
```

You can remove a trigger by adding the `--remove` flag. This allows you to run an OpenShift build
or run a scheduled import to keep your applications up to date..

Trigger updates are alpha in 3.6.0.

- Update Kubernetes resources on image change [\#13242](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13242)


#### Build cleanup policy

Build configs now support two parameters to control how many successful and failed builds are retained. By default, no limit is set and all builds are retained. The fields are  `spec.failedBuildsHistoryLimit` and `spec.successfulBuildsHistoryLimit`.

- Cleanup policy for builds [\#13788](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13788)


#### Unification with Kubernetes authorization and core code

The v3.6.0 release integrates a large number of changes the OpenShift team has contributed to 
Kubernetes around security, authorization, RBAC, and core code refactoring. While this will continue for several releases, the OpenShift and Kubernetes RBAC resources are being aligned and the primary API going forward for RBAC will be the Kubernetes version. The existing APIs will remain, especially those that expose features not yet supported in Kubernetes like scoped tokens.

Starting in this release, all OpenShift RBAC resources are automatically migrated to Kubernetes RBAC resources. Users should not see any change in behavior while these migrations occur.

Future releases will include migrating from SecurityContextConstraints to PodSecurityPolicy as well naming and policy updates to system managed policies.

- Use upstream system:masters authorizer [\#14006](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/14006)
  - Switch to policy watch [\#14194](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/14194)
- Use upstream namespace cleanup controller [\#13587](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13587)
- Use bootstrap cluster roles from kube [\#14026](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/14026)
- Use upstream x509 request header authenticator [\#14007](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/14007)
- Use upstream initialization for most controllers [\#14126](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/14126)
- Use upstream remote authentication and authorization [\#14011](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/14011)
- Use upstream initialization for the replication controller [\#14033](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/14033)
- Synchronize OpenShift RBAC to Kubernetes RBAC [\#14064](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/14064)
  - Split resource and non-resource rules during conversion [\#14454](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/14454)


#### End to end TLS - never generate a certificate again!

The [service serving certificate](https://docs.openshift.com/container-platform/3.5/dev_guide/secrets.html#service-serving-certificate-secrets) feature makes it easy to generate a valid TLS server certificate for your applications for securely serving HTTPS within a cluster. The router is now enabled to automatically reencrypt traffic to services that use these certificates for routes that specify a blank `spec.tls.destinationCACertificate` field. When a cluster is configured with a default wildcard certificate, this means that you can deploy applications to OpenShift that are secured end to end without having to generate or manage your own certificates.

See the [Prometheus example](https://github.com/openshift/origin/blob/master/examples/prometheus/prometheus.yaml#L54)
for this in action. The service requests generation of a secret `prometheus-tls` containing a TLS serving certificate for `prometheus.NAMESPACE.svc`, and the route points to the service with the TLS type `Reencrypt`, but without a `destinationCACertificate`. The router will automatically fill in the `service-ca.crt` file, which is available in every pod.


#### Sign and verify image signatures

OpenShift has natively supported detached signing certificates on images for several releases, and this release adds a new CLI command to make it easy for an administrator to verify the signatures on images manually or as part of an automated image publish flow. This allows the web UI and CLI to show information to the end user about the state of the signature.

See `oc adm verify-image-signature` for more.

- Verify signatures [\#13585](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13585)
- cli: do not require --expected-identity when removing all signatures [\#14125](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/14125)


#### Other Features

- build: Display jenkins url for pipeline build [\#13979](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13979)
- registry: Add prometheus metrics for dockerregistry [\#12711](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/12711)
  - Force to specify not empty secret for metrics endpoint [\#13884](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13884)
- route: Sanitize certificates from routes in the router [\#13897](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13897)
- storage: iSCSI CHAP support [\#14112](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/14112)
- route: Allow controlling spec.host via a new permission [\#13905](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13905)
- prometheus: Make the Prometheus example a fully automated secure deployment [\#13782](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13782)
- ha: Enable leader election on endpoints for controllers [\#14094](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/14094)
- router: Add defaults and env control of the fin timeouts in the router [\#14220](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/14220)
- router: Make HAProxy's log format configurable [\#13029](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13029)
- sdn: Add an OPENSHIFT-ADMIN-OUTPUT-RULES chain for admins to use [\#14221](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/14221)
- server: Prepare for API aggregation by supporting the new Kube aggregation endpoint [\#14285](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/14285)
- router: Shuffle endpoints for routes [\#14008](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/14008)

- web: Update overview to use toast notifications [\#1654](https://github.com/openshift/origin-web-console/pull/1654)

- web: Add landing page tour [\#1508](https://github.com/openshift/origin-web-console/pull/1508)
- web: Support filtering provisioned services on overview [\#1444](https://github.com/openshift/origin-web-console/pull/1444)
- web: Only show service catalog resources when available [\#1573](https://github.com/openshift/origin-web-console/pull/1573)

- web: disambiguate kinds on other resources by showing group [\#1478](https://github.com/openshift/origin-web-console/pull/1478)
- web: Bug 1447997 - Show warning for unsupported resource versions [\#1512](https://github.com/openshift/origin-web-console/pull/1512)
- web: Update the Other Resources Page to only show resources supporting the 'List' verb [\#1572](https://github.com/openshift/origin-web-console/pull/1572)



### Bugs

- admission: Support legacy admission configurations without kind fields set [\#14272](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/14272)

- cli: Add `request-timeout` val to `oc login` restclient [\#12062](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/12062)

name: v1.5.1
body:
This is a patch release of OpenShift Origin.

## Changes

[v1.5.1](https://github.com/openshift/origin/tree/v1.5.1) (2017-05-16) [Full Changelog](https://github.com/openshift/origin/compare/v1.5.0...v1.5.1)


### Bugs

- sdn: fix initialization order to prevent crash on node startup [\#13767](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13767)
- router: Match subpaths correctly when path contains trailing slash [\#13923](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13923)


## Release SHA256 Checksums


name: v1.5.0
body:
This is the release of OpenShift Origin 1.5.

## Changes

[Roadmap for the v1.5 release](https://ci.openshift.redhat.com/releases_overview.html#1.5)

[v1.5.0](https://github.com/openshift/origin/tree/v1.5.0) (2017-04-21) [Full Changelog](https://github.com/openshift/origin/compare/v1.5.0-rc.0...v1.5.0)


### Component updates

- Additional patches to Kubernetes 1.5.2
  - 37845: Azure disk volume fixes [\#13218](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13218)
  - 38925: Fix nil pointer issue when making mounts for container [\#13270](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13270)
  - 39751: Changed default scsi controller type [\#13314](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13314)
  - 39752: Fix panic in vSphere cloud provider [\#13314](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13314)
  - 39754: Fix fsGroup to vSphere [\#13314](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13314)
  - 39757: Fix space in volumePath in vSphere [\#13314](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13314)
  - 40066: Set custom PollingDelay of 5 seconds for Azure VirtualMachinesClient [\#13218](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13218)
  - 40417: Always detach volumes in operator executor [\#13251](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13251)
  - 40693: fix for vSphere DeleteVolume [\#13314](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13314)
  - 41217: Fix wrong VM name is retrieved by the vSphere Cloud Provider [\#13314](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13314)
  - 41226: Fix for detach volume when node is not present/ powered off [\#13314](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13314)
  - 41436: Fix bug in status manager TerminatePod [\#13377](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13377)
  - 42275: discovery restmapping should always prefer /v1 [\#13727](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13727)
  - 42622: Preserve custom etcd prefix compatibility for etcd3 [\#13299](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13299)
  - 42973: Fix selinux support in vsphere [\#13373](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13373)
  - 43460: Remove unused DockerManager daemon version [\#13513](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13513)

### Bugs

- hack: Remove need for docker in build-images, use multi-tag [\#13394](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13394)
- images: Fix image pruning with both strong & weak refs [\#13677](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13677)
- images: Insecure istag allows for insecure transport [\#13274](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13274)
- install: Restrict packages from CentOS to OVS only [\#13684](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13684)
- install: Remove the excluders origin-excluder [\#13402](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13402)
- network: Fix service IP validation to handle "ClusterIP: None" [\#13787](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13787)
- network: Fix single-node-cluster local multicast delivery [\#13768](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13768)
- network: Fix race between ovsdb-server.service and node service [\#13418](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13418)
- router: Prevent the router from deadlocking itself when calling Commit() [\#13744](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13744)
- security: Update namespace finalizer to delete RoleBindingRestrictions [\#13588](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13588)
- Revert "Fix of BUG 1405440" [\#13348](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13348)


## Release SHA256 Checksums

```
7100e3c9324ddb31cd0bee1c0bc74d11f79aa580f7c8776eba321094029503ab  openshift-origin-client-tools-v1.5.0-031cbe4-linux-32bit.tar.gz
e928067175be0e8a5947c21ebbbf1359687846749e83411b7cd0b99759968605  openshift-origin-client-tools-v1.5.0-031cbe4-linux-64bit.tar.gz

e9bd3c92842acb17ab920b663dfb80f094707fbac8a92dde341631dbfdb13628  openshift-origin-server-v1.5.0-031cbe4-linux-64bit.tar.gz
```

name: v3.6.0-alpha.1
body:
This is a feature release of OpenShift Origin.

## Backwards Compatibility

- The Jenkins v1 image is now deprecated - use the new v2 image which has access to the new Jenkins BlueOcean UI [\#13605](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13605)
- By default, new clusters will limit which image registries can be imported from by default [\#13313](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13313)
- Builds of i386 OpenShift have been temporarily removed due to bugs in Go 1.7 [\#13686](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13686)


## Changes

[Roadmap for the v3.6 release](https://ci.openshift.redhat.com/releases_overview.html#3.6)

[v3.6.0-alpha.1](https://github.com/openshift/origin/tree/v3.6.0-alpha.1) (2017-04-12) [Full Changelog](https://github.com/openshift/origin/compare/v3.6.0-alpha.0...v3.6.0-alpha.1)


## API

- Deployments
  - The securityContext field is now copied over to lifecycle hook pods, which means they will share user, group, fsGroup, and SELinux settings [\#12733](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/12733)
- Authorization
  - The `attributeRestrictions` field in subject access reviews is deprecated and will be removed in a future release, to be consistent with the new approach of having multiple resource types for access reviews. [\#13466](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13466)
- Networking:
  - CIDRs that are provided to ClusterNetwork, HostSubnet, and EgressNetworkPolicy must now be valid and in canonical form to prevent accidental leaks of network info. [\#13508](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13508)


### Component updates

- Updates to Kubernetes
  - 37380: Improve error reporting in Ceph RBD provisioner [\#13017](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13017)
  - 42959: Delete host exec pods faster [\#13337](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13337)
  - 43762: refactor getPidsForProcess and change error handling [\#13597](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13597)
  - <carry>: add SeccompProfiles to SecurityContextConstraintsDescriber. [\#13509](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13509)
  - <carry>: update clientset generator for openshift groups [\#12953](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/12953)
- Updates to Docker distribution


### Features

#### Add a Service Broker for Templates

Templates allow users in OpenShift to easily define, share, and deploy precanned applications. The new service broker will allow any template to be
exposed in the service catalog and then consumed by end users. The broker will initially support deploying the template inside of the user's project,
but eventually allow templates to be used to deployed on other clusters and linked back to the end user.

To support the service broker, a new resource has been added to projects - the TemplateInstance. This lets you declaratively instantiate a template
and then in the future update that template.

Template service broker is tech preview for OpenShift 3.6

- Template service broker [\#12953](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/12953)

#### Add metrics to routers

The router has been upgraded to return Prometheus metrics for routes and the pods under those routes.  New clusters will have the `ROUTER_METRICS_TYPE` environment variable set to `haproxy` and `ROUTER_LISTEN_ADDR` set to `0.0.0.0:1935`, which turns on metrics on port 1935 (protected by the `ROUTER_STATS_PASSWORD` and user).  

The exposed metrics describe per route, service, and pod information about the traffic flowing over the routers, and can be gathered by an Prometheus capable collector to report information about edge traffic.

* Expose metrics in the router [\#13337](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13337)

#### Support F5 partitions in the router

F5 BigIP servers allow for multiple active "partitions" to be managed for security and failure separation at the API level.  This change adds support for targeting a partition from the F5 router management code and makes it possible for OpenShift to manage only a subset of a given F5 router.

* Support F5 partition paths [\#13391](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13391)


#### Add webhook support to builds for GitLab and BitBucket

Like the GitHub and generic web hooks, this allows users to create a webhook trigger with `oc set triggers` and then use that webhook from
a GitLab or BitBucket repository. The hook supports extracting the commit message and author and adding it to the trigger cause.

- Support gitlab and bitbucket webhooks [\#13389](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13389)

#### Control which registries can be imported from

A new configuration flag has been added to the OpenShift config that limits which registries users can import images from by default. Administrators
who can create images directly via the API can import any image, but regular users will receive an error if they import from an unsupported registry.

By default, the list of registries is set to the important publicly hosted registries.

- Allow administrators to control which registries can be imported [\#13313](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13313)


#### Send events when builds are started or complete

A new event is sent when a build starts running, and when it succeeds, fails, or is cancelled another event will be reported. This makes it easier
to see the timeline of events in the CLI and web console.

- Send events on builds [\#13660](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13660)


#### Create and deploy applications with the service catalog in the web console

The service catalog is an important new component of OpenShift and Kubernetes and will be tech preview in 3.6. The web console will expose
binding services provisioned in the catalog to existing applications, as well as deploying new components into a project from the console
(via the template broker). More coming soon!

- web: First prototype of creating service bindings from the console [\#1395](https://github.com/openshift/origin-web-console/pull/1395)
- web: Add catalog to web console [\#1389](https://github.com/openshift/origin-web-console/pull/1389)


### Bugs

- admin: Use correct PEM header when generating key pairs [\#13498](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13498)
- auth: SelfSubjectAccessReview does not authorize with api groups [\#13715](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13715)
- build: Add a label to built images containing the name of the build [\#13703](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13703)
- build: Adding generic build failed reason when no specific error shows up [\#13590](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13590)
- build: Ensure next build is kicked off when a build completes [\#13670](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13670)
- cli: `oc tag` should not allow setting an alias tag across different image streams [\#13632](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13632)
- client: mark Image type +nonNamespaced=true [\#13525](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13525)
- cluster: Set DNS bind and IP address correctly for newer server versions [\#13539](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13539)
- cluster: Simplify the output of `oc cluster up` [\#13636](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13636)
- cluster: Use router suffix for router certificate hostnames [\#13647](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13647)
- deploy: Add owner reference to rc from the deployer [\#13582](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13582)
- deploy: Carry over the securityContext from the deployment config to lifecycle hook [\#12733](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/12733)
- deploy: Retry pending deployments longer before failing them [\#13550](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13550)
- deploy: Retry scaling when the server's caches are not warmed up (prevent a race with namespace creation) [\#13279](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13279)
- deploy: Use patch API for pausing and resuming deployment config [\#13613](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13613)
- image: Ensure both strong and weak image refs prevent pruning [\#13671](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13671)
- image: Image imports should be considered long-running requests and allowed to take more than 30s to complete [\#13458](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13458)
- network: Port openshift-sdn-ovs script to go [\#12145](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/12145)
- network: SDN egress policy should not firewall endpoints from global namespaces [\#13071](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13071)
- network: The IP reported for node by openshift-sdn can change on restart - make it stable [\#13645](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13645)
- network: Wait for namespaces to be loaded before setting VNID, which prevents temporary network unavailability in pods [\#13666](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13666)
- newapp: Address redundant line if new-app error output [\#13541](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13541)
- newapp: Fix extra lines in new-app output [\#13540](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13540)
- node: Fix mount propagation on rootfs for containerized node [\#13327](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13327)
- node: system container mounts /rootfs rslave [\#13499](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13499)
- perf: Used shared informer in build controllers [\#13510](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13510)
- registry: Add --fs-group and --supplementary-groups to `oc adm registry` [\#12951](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/12951)
- router: Ensure that route creation and deletion does not panic by tracking routes by UID [\#13494](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13494)
- security: Correctly delete RoleBindingRestrictions when namespaces are deleted [\#13563](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13563)
- security: Refactor impersonation code to be easier to read and more specific [\#13630](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13630)
- security: The RestrictUsersAdmission admission controller should allow service account namespaces to be implicit [\#13649](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13649)
- template: Better error when an unrecognized type is found [\#13624](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13624)
- web: Allow more space on the nav bar for extensions that use a context switcher [\#1376](https://github.com/openshift/origin-web-console/pull/1376)
- web: Fix wrapping issues with very long usernames [\#1377](https://github.com/openshift/origin-web-console/pull/1377)
- web: Support a query param for expanding advanced builder options [\#1398](https://github.com/openshift/origin-web-console/pull/1398)
- web: Fix "View Membership" from catalog project summary [\#1407](https://github.com/openshift/origin-web-console/pull/1407)
- web: Split off next-steps into component [\#1400](https://github.com/openshift/origin-web-console/pull/1400)
- web: Create a binding from a svc to an app [\#1414](https://github.com/openshift/origin-web-console/pull/1414)


## Release SHA256 Checksums

```
38378daa2945bbba332c1af2d857ff09fded70420ee742d72a704fdd4d242043  openshift-origin-client-tools-v3.6.0-alpha.1-46942ad-linux-64bit.tar.gz
ea35585dcdd3719555396f2e58141cd68ba1a94c033b1bc89d72c4347b543267  openshift-origin-client-tools-v3.6.0-alpha.1-46942ad-mac.zip
a336cc57f1aad5c88cd5c453e9068831e00d6d052c9ace59770bdabd39413ba4  openshift-origin-client-tools-v3.6.0-alpha.1-46942ad-windows.zip
ac72399befd3a7f147d09d556853f6871a9a78bec0eb63f9a5e56fb01a094eb3  openshift-origin-server-v3.6.0-alpha.1-46942ad-linux-64bit.tar.gz
```

name: v3.6.0-alpha.0
body:
This is a feature release towards OpenShift 3.6. 

Please note that we have updated the version numbering scheme for OpenShift to be consistent with the OpenShift version history to minimize impact to the installer and other related documentation and web links.  OpenShift 3.6 replaces version number 1.6, and will be based on Kubernetes 1.6.

## Changes

[Roadmap for the 3.6 release](https://ci.openshift.redhat.com/releases_overview.html#3.6)

[v3.6.0-alpha.0](https://github.com/openshift/origin/tree/v3.6.0-alpha.0) (2017-03-21) [Full Changelog](https://github.com/openshift/origin/compare/v1.5.0-rc.0...v3.6.0-alpha.0)


## API

### Move OpenShift API resources to their own API groups

API groups in Kubernetes allow extension of core APIs and better separation of unrelated API types.
In this release we are introducing API groups for all OpenShift API resources so that in the future
they can be used as extensions to a base Kubernetes distribution. These resources continue to be available
at `/oapi/v1`, but clients should begin using the new paths.

New API groups are available from the OpenShift API server at:

- `/apis/apps.openshift.io/v1`: DeploymentConfigs
- `/apis/authorization.openshift.io/v1`: OpenShift role based access control
- `/apis/build.openshift.io/v1`: Build configs and builds
- `/apis/image.openshift.io/v1`: Images, ImageStreams, and other supporting resources
- `/apis/oauth.openshift.io/v1`: OpenShift OAuth resources like ClientAuthorization and Tokens
- `/apis/network.openshift.io/v1`: Network policy for openshift-sdn and NetworkEgressPolicy
- `/apis/project.openshift.io/v1`: Projects and project requests for role based access to namespaces
- `/apis/quota.openshift.io/v1`: ClusterQuota and supporting namespaced resources
- `/apis/route.openshift.io/v1`: Routes
- `/apis/security.openshift.io/v1`: PodSecurityPolicyReview resources
- `/apis/template.openshift.io/v1`: Templates
- `/apis/user.openshift.io/v1`: User and group resources

Stored templates, configuration, and client code intended for use with 3.6 and above can substitute the 
`apiVersion` field for an object with `GROUP/v1`. CLI code will continue to generate objects with the
legacy apiVersion `v1` to enable working with older versions. On many commands you can use
`--output-version` to indicate the new version

- API groups [\#12986](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/12986)
  - image: mutate group admission attributes to ensure grouped resources are captured [\#13421](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13421)
  - cli: Fix bulk generator to prefer legacy group [\#13457](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13457)
- Builds
  - All fields related to extended builds have been marked as deprecated and will be removed in a future release [\#13063](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13063)
  - Build webhooks return structured data including the created build name [\#12573](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/12573)


### Component updates

- Kubernetes:
    - vSphere driver fixes:
    - 39752: Fix panic in vSphere cloud provider [\#13159](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13159)
    - 39754: Fix fsGroup for vSphere [\#13159](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13159)
    - 39757: Fix space in volumePath in vSphere [\#13159](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13159)
    - 40693: Fix for vSphere DeleteVolume [\#13159](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13159)
    - 41217: Fix wrong VM name retrieval from the vSphere Cloud Provider [\#13159](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13159)
    - 42973: Fix selinux support in vSphere [\#13374](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13374)
  - Other fixes
    - 36774: Allow auth proxy to set groups and extra info [\#12803](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/12803)
    - 38818: Add sequential allocator for device names in AWS [\#13130](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13130)
    - 38925: Fix nil pointer issue when making mounts for container [\#13269](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13269)
    - 39751: Changed default SCSI controller type [\#13159](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13159)
    - 40080: Fix unit tests for Update action when AllowUnconditionalUpdate is false [\#12541](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/12541)
    - 40301: Serve request header certificate CA [\#13163](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13163)
    - 40935: Include subresource in subjectaccessreview [\#13085](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13085)
    - 41226: Fix for detach volume when node is not present / powered off [\#13159](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13159)
    - 41436: Fix bug in status manager TerminatePod [\#13378](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13378)
    - 41455: Fix AWS device allocator to only use valid device names [\#13130](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13130)
    - 41814: Add client-ca to configmap in kube-public [\#13217](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13217)
    - 42275: API Discovery should always prefer /v1 [\#13152](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13152)
    - 42337: Plumb cipher/tls version serving options [\#13167](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13167)
    - 42491: Make the system:authenticated group addition smarter [\#13247](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13247)
    - 42622: Ensure etcd custom prefixes are not lost when upgrading to etcd3 [\#13298](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13298)
    - <carry>: Allow use of '*' as a capability in Security Context Constraints. [\#12875](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/12875)
    - <drop>: Add appliedclusterresourcequotas to ignoredGroupVersionResources in namespace controller [\#12986](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/12986)
    - <drop>: Admission namespace isAccessReview, remove post 1.7 rebase [\#13128](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13128)
    - <drop>: Wait for loopback permissions, remove after updating loopback authenticator [\#13217](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13217)
    - revert: add ExtraClientCACerts to SecureServingInfo" [\#13163](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13163)


### Features

#### Redesigned OpenShift Web Console Overview [\#1335](https://github.com/openshift/origin-web-console/pull/1335)

The web console has been heavily revised with a focus on showing the relationships between services and deployments,
with significant enhancements to layout and information presentation.

Other changes:

- web: Add fullscreen terminal support [\#1167](https://github.com/openshift/origin-web-console/pull/1167)
- web: Additional checks for security concerns during Import YAML and Template process [\#1321](https://github.com/openshift/origin-web-console/pull/1321)


#### Support environment variables as input to Jenkins Pipeline builds and build args to Docker builds

This makes it easier to parameterize these two classes of builds

- builds: Add env var support to the pipeline strategy [\#12323](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/12323)
  - Allow build request override of pipeline strategy envs [\#13160](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13160)
- builds: Support build args on Docker builds [\#12439](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/12439), [\#13257](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13257)


#### Other Features

- admin: Add a new network diagnostic pod image [\#12982](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/12982)
  - admin: Use DefaultImagePrefix instead of hardcoded 'openshift/origin' for network diagnostic image. [\#13107](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13107)
- documentation: Describe networking requirements for vendors replacing openshift-sdn [\#12981](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/12981)
- image: Support `reference-policy` on `oc import-image` [\#13339](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13339)
- jenkins: Support automatic use of 32 vs. 64 bit JVMs with the integrated Jenkins for more efficient memory use [\#13032](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13032)
- registry: Allow control over TLS version and ciphers for docker-registry [\#13258](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13258)
- security: The privileged SCC should be able to use all capabilities, even those not yet defined [\#12875](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/12875)
- security: Add a client for SCC review [\#12478](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/12478)
  - security: Fix issue in SCC review defaulting [\#13044](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13044)
- security: Make ciphers/tls version configurable [\#13167](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13167)
- tests: Bundle test files with the extended.test binary in the RPM so tests can be run anywhere [\#13361](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13361)


### Bugs

- builds: Add parent BuildConfig to Build OwnerReferences [\#12961](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/12961)
- builds: Prevent build updates from reverting the build phase [\#13048](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13048)
- builds: No failure reason displayed when build failed using invalid contextDir [\#13203](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13203)
- builds: Work around docker race condition when running build post commit hooks [\#13100](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13100)
- builds: Retry pulling an image if the build fails [\#13380](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13380)
- cli: Don't print odd command names when the binary is symlinked [\#12781](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/12781)
- clusterup: Switch to nip.io from xip.io for default cluster up wildcard DNS [\#13023](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13023)
- clusterup: Warn on error parsing Docker version [\#13201](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13201)
- clusterup: Use loopback interface for nodename and default server IP [\#13112](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13112)
- deploy: Prevent rolling back to the same dc version [\#13104](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13104)
- etcd: Wait on startup for etcd to stabilize in v3 mode [\#13261](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13261)
- ha: Sync etcd endpoints during lease acquisition in case of failover [\#13082](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13082)
- image: ImageStreamImage references are not being resolved [\#13089](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13089)
- image: Pruning could fail if some security configuration is not provided [\#13072](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13072)
- image: Ensure all remote layers are checked when someone pulls an image [\#13001](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13001)
- image: Support insecure flag on image import [\#13114](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13114)
- image: Allow import rate to be set to unlimited [\#13315](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13315)
- install: Change logging deployer image name from 'logging-deployment' to 'logging-deployer' [\#13151](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13151)
- install: Changes required to support Docker versions beyond 1.12, including oc cluster up [\#13016](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13016)
- install: Install ceph-common pkg to support RBD provisioning [\#12896](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/12896)
- login: Suggest a different port on login [\#12654](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/12654)
- network: Increase default ARP cache size on nodes for the router [\#13034](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13034)
- network: Add validation to SDN objects with invalid name funcs [\#13124](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13124)
- network: Output VXLAN multicast flow in sorted order [\#13061](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13061)
- network: Improve SDN validation messages and error messages [\#13154](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13154)
- network: make /var/lib/cni persistent to ensure IPAM allocations stick around across node restart [\#13231](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13231)
- network: Attempt to handle fragmented packets when processing service traffic [\#13162](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13162)
- network: Fix race between ovsdb-server.service and node service [\#13417](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13417)
- newapp: Enhance new-app circular test to handle ImageStreamImage refs [\#13233](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13233)
- newapp: Make new-app report better errors [\#12978](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/12978)
- node: Node should default to controller attach/detach [\#12726](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/12726)
  - controllers: Provide event recorder to attach/detach controller [\#13175](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13175)
- registry: Tolerate upstreams for pullthrough that don't support all content headers [\#13283](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13283)
- release: Enable release repository by default [\#13473](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13473)
- router: Fix cookies for reencrypt routes with InsecureEdgeTerminationPolicy "Allow" [\#13221](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13221)
- router: Use a TCP socket check for the router liveness probe to avoid connection starvation [\#13121](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13121)
- router: Set `timeout http-keep-alive` when `timeout http-request` is used to prevent short sessions [\#13051](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13051)
- router: Improve whitespace in the generated router config [\#13358](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13358)
- security: Add stateful sets permissions to disruption controller [\#13187](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13187)
- security: Switch personal SAR to upstream selfsubjectaccessreviews.authorization.k8s.io [\#13256](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13256)
- security: Use more of the upstream authorizer [\#13259](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13259), [\#13287](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13287), [\#13296](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13296), [\#13415](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13415)
- security: Add a cluster role for external PV provisioners [\#13333](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13333)
  - Add list events permission to pv-provisioner cluster role [\#13420](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13420)
- security: Improve descriptions of SCCs [\#13404](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13404)
- security: Add conversions from RBAC resources to origin resources [\#13334](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13334)
- upgrade: Add an image migration script for keys affected by v1.4.0 [\#13059](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13059), [\#13117](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/13117)
- web: Fix orderBy calls that were passed hashes so we dont get errors with ang 1.5 [\#1250](https://github.com/openshift/origin-web-console/pull/1250)
- web: Eliminate kve bookkeeping in controllers [\#1090](https://github.com/openshift/origin-web-console/pull/1090)
- web: Enable truncation of long labels within table cell. Fixes https://github.com/openshift/origin-web-console/issues/1230 [\#1231](https://github.com/openshift/origin-web-console/pull/1231)
- web: Fix bug searching builders with tags that reference other tags [\#1243](https://github.com/openshift/origin-web-console/pull/1243)
- web: Removing an inappropriate class used to wrap inline radio form controls. And switch inline margin from left to right side to allow for alignment left. Fixes https://github.com/openshift/origin-web-console/issues/1240 Fixes https://github.com/openshift/origin-web-console/issues/1234 [\#1239](https://github.com/openshift/origin-web-console/pull/1239)
- web: Removing orphaned Settings templates and controller [\#1255](https://github.com/openshift/origin-web-console/pull/1255)
- web: Removing orphaned environments directive [\#1257](https://github.com/openshift/origin-web-console/pull/1257)
- web: Relax SHA prefix regular expression for PodsService.getImageIDs [\#1265](https://github.com/openshift/origin-web-console/pull/1265)
- web: Fix extra space before comma in build status message [\#1268](https://github.com/openshift/origin-web-console/pull/1268)
- web: Only show admitted routes as links [\#1271](https://github.com/openshift/origin-web-console/pull/1271)
- web: Make route services pie chart responsive [\#1275](https://github.com/openshift/origin-web-console/pull/1275)
- web: Fix missing "Create Source Secret" link [\#1280](https://github.com/openshift/origin-web-console/pull/1280)
- web: Remove emptyMessage var if its not changing [\#1203](https://github.com/openshift/origin-web-console/pull/1203)
- web: Updating PatternFly and Angular-PatternFly to v3.21.0 [\#1284](https://github.com/openshift/origin-web-console/pull/1284)
- web: Bug 1425728 - Fix cancel from add config files page [\#1286](https://github.com/openshift/origin-web-console/pull/1286)
- web: Bug 1425686 - Make "Add Item" and "Remove Item" headline case [\#1285](https://github.com/openshift/origin-web-console/pull/1285)
- web: Aligning kebab styles with PatternFly [\#1263](https://github.com/openshift/origin-web-console/pull/1263)
- web: Resolve bug where list-view-item top border disappeared [\#1288](https://github.com/openshift/origin-web-console/pull/1288)
- web: Fix problem with add to project from Git repository [\#1290](https://github.com/openshift/origin-web-console/pull/1290)
- web: Bump openshift-jvm to 1.1.6 [\#1292](https://github.com/openshift/origin-web-console/pull/1292)
- web: Making rule less specific so it applies even if another node (ng) [\#1293](https://github.com/openshift/origin-web-console/pull/1293)
- web: Fix bug where margin is inconsistent on .table inside .table-responsive [\#1254](https://github.com/openshift/origin-web-console/pull/1254)
- web: Don't resize log viewer before visible [\#1294](https://github.com/openshift/origin-web-console/pull/1294)
- web: Fix bug 1426118, ignore namespace except for service account [\#1295](https://github.com/openshift/origin-web-console/pull/1295)
- web: Include vendor prefixes required for consistent styling of placeholder text Fixes https://github.com/openshift/origin-web-console/issues/1259 [\#1260](https://github.com/openshift/origin-web-console/pull/1260)
- web: Set larger label-filter default input click targets based on statdard media query widths [\#1216](https://github.com/openshift/origin-web-console/pull/1216)

- web: Removing top margin causing unnecessary above the .log-header on the monitoring page. Adding class to adjust spacing when ui-select is shown Fixes https://github.com/openshift/origin-web-console/issues/1233 [\#1238](https://github.com/openshift/origin-web-console/pull/1238)
