name: v1.3.0-rc1
body:
This is release candidate 1 of OpenShift Origin 1.3.0.

## Backwards Compatibility
- HAProxy router template format has changed
  - As part of the expanded features added to the HAProxy router in 1.3, a configuration file format change was necessary to the internal structure used by the router config template (the `haproxy.config.template`) file.  Instructions for adapting to the new format are located [here](https://github.com/rajatchopra/routing_data_structure_changes/blob/master/README.md)
- Jenkins auto-deployment has been disabled - see [#10260](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10260) for more

## API Changes
- Networking
  - Many of the network API objects have much stricter validation. [#10466](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10466)
- Routes
  - All backends in a route may be set to have zero weight, which means no traffic should be sent to that backend. [#10428](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10428)

## Component updates
- Updated to Kubernetes [1.3.5 + patches](https://github.com/openshift/kubernetes/commits/52492b4bff99ef3b8ca617d385a3ff0612f9402d)
  - 32000: Update node status instead of node in kubelet [#10790](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10790)
  - 31730: Fixes for attach-detach controller enablement on existing nodes [#10748](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10748)
  - 30690: Don't bind pre-bound pvc & pv if size request not satisfied [#10522](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10522)
  - 31627: make deep copy of quota objects before mutations [#10704](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10704)
  - 31396: Fixed integer overflow bug in rate limiter [#10646](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10646)
  - 31047: Close websocket stream when client closes [#10550](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10550)
  - 25308: fix rollout nil panic issue [#10543](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10543)
  - 29093: Fix panic race in scheduler cache from 28886 [#10518](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10518)
  - 30839: queueActionLocked requires write lock [#10504](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10504)
  - 30624: Node controller deletePod return true if there are pods pending deletion [#10503](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10503)
  - 30731: Always return command output for exec probes and kubelet RunInContainer [#10494](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10494)
  - 30796: Quota usage checking ignores unrelated resources [#10493](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10493)
  - 28234: Make sure --record=false is acknowledged when passed to commands [#10486](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10486)
  - 30736: Close websocket watch when client closes [#10475](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10475)
  - 29639:<drop>: Fix default resource limits (node allocatable) for downward api volumes and env vars [#10467](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10467)
  - 27541: Attach init container [#10427](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10427)
  - 30510: Endpoint controller logs errors during behavior [#10415](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10415)
  - 30626: prevent RC hotloop on denied pods [#10414](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10414)
  - 30533: Validate involvedObject.Namespace matches event.Namespace [#10392](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10392)
  - 30313: remove duplicate errors from aggregate error outputs [#10317](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10317)
  - 29212: hpa: ignore scale targets whose replica count is 0 [#10305](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10305)
  - 29982: Fix PVC.Status.Capacity and AccessModes after binding [#10268](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10268)
  - 30162: return err on `oc run --image` with invalid value [#10250](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10250)
  - 31446: fix delay establishing log streaming connection [#10617](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10617)
  - 31353: fix duplicate validation/field/errors [#10613](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10613)
  - Additional bulk picks [#10247](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10247), [#10385](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10385), [#10541](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10541)
- Updated Docker distribution
  - Fix pushing to GCS storage [#10640](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10640)

## Features

[v1.3.0-rc1](https://github.com/openshift/origin/tree/v1.3.0-rc1) (2016-08-07)
[Full Changelog](https://github.com/openshift/origin/compare/v1.3.0-alpha.3...v1.3.0-rc1)

### Add setting and viewing route weights from the CLI

The A/B route balancing feature now has a CLI command to manage it `oc set route-backends` and route weights show up in the `oc get` and `oc describe` commands for the route.
Routes may have one or more optional backend services with weights controlling how much traffic flows to each service. Traffic is assigned proportional to the combined weights
of each backend. A weight of zero means that the backend will receive no traffic. If all weights are zero the route will not send traffic to any backends.

You can bulk set route backends by specifying their name and weight:

```
$ oc set route-backends myroute prod=99 canary=1
```

Which will send 99% of traffic to the `prod` service and 1% to the `canary` service. If the service does not exist no traffic will be sent.  You can keep the service listed as
a backend but not send traffic to it by specifying weight 0:

```
$ oc set route-backends myroute prod=1 canary=0
```

See the help for more advanced incremental adjustments (`--adjust canary=+10%`).
- Add CLI support for routes with multiple backends [#10551](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10551).

### Support bare-metal, highly available IPs for services

For users deploying onto bare metal without a cloud provider, access to highly available TCP load balancing can be difficult. OpenShift 1.3 extends the supported ip-failover
router HA solution to also enable HA Kube services with failover. Administrators would configure HA router nodes and then ensure that a block of IPs is routed to those nodes
in the IP failover configuration. That block would then be configured in the OpenShift `master-config.yaml`:

```
networkConfig:
  ingressIPNetworkCIDR: 172.46.0.0/16
```

This is the default behavior, and can be disabled by setting the value equal to `0.0.0.0/32`. When a service of `type=LoadBalancer` is created, a new IP would be assigned to the
service and traffic would flow to that service. Note that running with a cloud provider disables this feature since the providers native service load balancer is used.
- Support network ingress on arbitrary IPs [#9454](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9454)
- Add a default ingress ip range [#10500](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10500)

### Image Policy API

Image policy allows you to manage which images are allowed to run on the cluster and perform resolution of image tags to image digests on demand (to lock the executed version).
Policy allows:
- Block images outside of the integrated registry from being used in pods
- Require the presence of an annotation on the underlying image (not settable by end users) to run the image
- Allow integrators to perform security scans of images and then block the image from being executed on the platform.

The default configuration will block images that are annotated in the internal registry - if the annotation `images.openshift.io/deny-execution` is set on an image referenced
by a pod to `true`, OpenShift will prevent that image from being run. This can be used by an external scanner to block certain images from being used.

See [the image policy documentation](https://docs.openshift.org/latest/admin_guide/image_policy.html) for more on configuring policy.
- Add image policy enforcement [#8995](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/8995)

### Build integrations with the cluster more easily

The new `oc observe` command is an experimental tool for reacting to changes in your Kubernetes cluster and building scripted interactions. It allows you to easily
get notified of changes to a particular resource type (like services, deployments, namespaces, persistent volumes) and invoke a command.

For example, if you want to send an email to your admin every time a node stops being reachable, create a script that takes

```
$ cat mail.sh
#!/bin/sh
if [[ $2 != 'False' ]]; then
  touch "/tmp/ready/$1"
  exit 0
fi
if [[ -f "/tmp/ready/$1" ]]; then
  echo mail -s "$1 went DOWN!" admin@mycompany.com "We're down at $(datetime)"
fi
rm "/tmp/ready/$1"

$ oc observe node -a '{{ range .status.conditions }}{{ if eq .type "Ready" }}{{ .status }}{{ end }}{{ end }}' --output gotemplate -- ./mail.sh
```

Whenever a node transitions from having condition `Ready` with status `True` to status `False`, an email will be sent to your admin.  See the `oc observe` help for
more suggestions and explanation of how observe can help you build simple integrations.

You can get observe as a Docker image via `docker pull openshift/observe:latest` - the `oc observe` command is the entrypoint and you can bind mount a kubeconfig file
to `/root/.kube/config`.
- Observe command [#4196](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/4196)

### Improve the OAuth Grant page

OpenShift embeds a full featured OAuth server for managing access to cluster resources. The OAuth authorization grant page has been improved to describe the scopes being
requested, the impact those scopes might have, and to warn users of any potential security risks. In addition, the grant page now allows the user to select which scopes
to grant.

![screen shot 2016-08-12 at 11 50 40 am](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/980082/17628398/222ca57c-6083-11e6-9a5c-836ea68e55cf.png)
- Improve OAuth Grant page and allow partial scope approval [#10321](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10321)

### Other Features
- project: Respect scope rules in list/watch projects [#10252](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10252)
- cli: Improve `oc describe imagestream` [#10405](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10405)

## Bugs
- admin: Add a command to separate projects when multi-tenant SDN is on - `oadm pod-network isolate-projects` [#10365](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10365)
- admin: Ignore negative value of grace-period passed to `oadm manage-node` [#10350](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10350)
- admin: Recognize gzipped empty layer when marking parents in oadm top images [#10293](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10293)
- admin: Return directly if no pods found when evacuating [#10447](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10447)
- bootstrap: Better support containerization on some Docker platforms in `oc cluster up` [#10571](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10571)
- builds: Avoid temporary delays in processing builds due to improper use of cache code [#10581](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10581)
- builds: Avoid using bsdtar for extraction during build [#10364](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10364)
- builds: Commit information not being properly output into build logs [#10515](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10515)
- builds: Don't perform pod deletion management for pipeline builds [#10370](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10370)
- builds: Ensure temporary files are closed if Docker 'DownloadFromContainer' fails [#10325](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10325)
- builds: Show namespace for custom strategy bc [#10340](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10340)
- builds: Validate CustomStrategy early [#10480](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10480)
- cli: Add `oc describe` help suggestion to cmds with `--container` option [#10469](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10469)
- cli: Add a line break when no events in describe [#10653](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10653)
- cli: Add new-app support for detecting .net apps [#10463](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10463)
- cli: Allow `--raw URL` to retrieve authenticated URLs from a server with `oc get` [#10542](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10542)
- cli: Avoid failures during scaling by fetching objects up front [#10684](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10684)
- cli: Better describe `oc tag -d` [#10597](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10597)
- cli: Deprecate --list option from `volumes` cmd [#10457](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10457)
- cli: Display an error when git is not available and --from-repo is requested in `oc start-build` [#10397](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10397)
- cli: Fix `oc extract` usage message for the `--keys` flag [#10614](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10614)
- cli: Fix oc project|projects when in cluster config [#10521](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10521)
- cli: Improve `oc set env` key-value pair matching for environment variables [#10619](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10619)
- cli: Improving circular dependency checking for new-build [#10067](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10067)
- cli: New app example improvements [#10534](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10534)
- cli: Project labels should be visible from `oc get` [#10329](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10329)
- cli: Remain in the current project at login if possible [#10378](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10378)
- cli: Return error in `oc set env RESOURCE` when no env args are provided [#10485](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10485)
- cli: Show restart count warnings only for latest deployment [#10440](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10440)
- cli: Suggest use of `oc get bc` on `oc start-build` error output [#10720](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10720)
- cli: Support init containers in 'oc debug' [#10578](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10578)
- cli: Tagging images across namespaces with `oc tag` was importing from the wrong location [#10510](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10510)
- cli: `oc extract` should default to current directory [#10468](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10468)
- cli: oc should not fail negotiating API versions against Kubernetes [#10824](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10824)
- deploy: Don't reprocess configs on stream updates yet [#10744](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10744)
- deploy: Emit event when cancelling a deployment [#10590](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10590)
- deploy: React to image stream changes more quickly during deployment processing [#10456](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10456)
- deploy: Retry conflicts when updating RC faster [#10507](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10507)
- deploy: Some image change triggers were not being matched on deployments [#10444](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10444)
- deploy: Wait for deployer pod to be running before getting logs [#10560](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10560)
- deploy: remove top level generator pkg [#10502](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10502)
- examples: Fix pre-deploy hook args on cakephp example [#10572](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10572)
- gitserver: Fix gitserver build config search [#10576](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10576)
- idling: Add previous-scale annotation for idled resources [#10421](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10421)
- idling: Clarify idle error and usage output [#10492](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10492)
- idling: Don't health-check idled services [#10420](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10420)
- idling: Ensure only endpoints are specified in `oc idle` [#10335](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10335)
- idling: Handle deleted services correctly without erroring out [#10648](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10648)
- images: Make import image more efficient [#10244](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10244)
- images: Sometimes tags are not updated when running `oc tag` to referenced tags [#10708](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10708)
- ipfailover: Fix range expansion on VRRP addresses [#10498](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10498)
- ipfailover: Stop using node selector as ipfailover label [#10388](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10388)
- jenkins: Add specific roles and permissions for access to the Jenkins console [#10649](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10649)
- jenkins: Fix autoprovision enabled field name [#10612](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10612)
- jenkins: Increase readiness timeout [#10593](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10593)
- network: Allow startup to continue even if nodes don't have EgressNetworkPolicy list permission [#10358](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10358)
- network: Clear kubelet-created initial NetworkUnavailable condition on GCE [#10545](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10545)
- network: Disabling idling should not turn off the service proxy [#10667](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10667)
- network: Periodically sync k8s iptables rules [#10465](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10465)
- network: Re-setup SDN on startup if ClusterNetworkCIDR changes [#10569](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10569)
- network: Regenerate proxy iptables rules on EgressNetworkPolicy change [#10652](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10652)
- network: Revert SDN automatic mode detection [#10751](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10751)
- network: SDN plugin name names were missed [#10432](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10432)
- policy: Allow registry-admin and registry-editor to create serviceaccounts [#10443](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10443)
- policy: Block setting ownerReferences and finalizers [#10464](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10464)
- policy: Reconcile non-resource-urls [#10785](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10785)
- project: Clean up requested project if there are errors creating template items [#10577](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10577)
- quota: Properly enforce image stream counts [#10517](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10517)
- registry: Handle older configuration files without erroring out on upgrade [#10673](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10673)
- registry: Login via token to the registry should use HTTP header info for redirection [#10418](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10418)
- registry: Properly reuse service clusterIP in `oadm registry` [#10496](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10496)
- registry: Properly serve the manifest configuration blob for images [#10805](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10805)
- registry: `servingCert` was not handled properly in `oadm registry` [#10442](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10442)
- router: Allowed 'true' for the DROP_SYN_DURING_RESTART variable [#10514](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10514)
- router: Enable secure cookie for secure-only edge routes [#10573](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10573)
- router: Extend DDOS protection to reencrypt and passthrough routes [#10513](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10513)
- router: Properly remove duplicates from routers [#10747](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10747)
- router: Set X-Forwarded-For headers for reencrypt routes. [#10318](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10318)
- router: Update the default certificate and allow for better replacement [#10345](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10345)
- router: Use annotations for tuning route healthcheck intervals [#10342](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10342)
- rpm: Build RPM using the build scripts [#10398](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10398)
- rpm: Make build spec file platform independent [#10695](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10695)
- s2i: Increase default timeout for operations against Docker [#10675](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10675)
- server: Add quota controller metrics [#10307](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10307)
- server: Call out config validation warnings more clearly [#10461](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10461)
- volume: Recycler pod was failing to recycle processes [#10454](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10454)
- Lots of code cleanup PRs, thanks to all who helped! [#10591](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10591), [#10589](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10589), [#10583](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10583), [#10557](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10557), [#10547](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10547), [#10446](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10446), [#10433](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10433), [#10409](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10409), [#10408](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10408), [#10399](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10399), [#10372](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10372)

name: v1.3.0-alpha.3
body:
This is an alpha feature release towards OpenShift Origin 1.3.0

## Backwards Compatibility
- Image Streams
  - In order to tag an image from one image stream into another via `oc tag` or the API, you must have permission to pull the image, not just permission to view the source image stream.  Running `oadm policy reconcile cluster-roles` will alter default roles so that tagging continues to work as normal.

## API Changes
- DNS:
  - SRV record responses have changed significantly to conform to new features enabled in Kubernetes 1.3. More details in [the 1.3 release notes issue](https://github.com/openshift/openshift-docs/issues/2507#issuecomment-236950715). Callers must now explicitly request the port by name and protocol to get the port info (e.g. `dig @server _http._tcp.kubernetes.default.svc.cluster.local`)
- Builds:
  - Build Request API should return NotFound if the parent build config does not exist [#9763](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9763)
  - Reject ImageStreamTag references on builds and build configs that are not well formed as validation errors [#9945](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9945)
  - Support YAML payloads for generic webhooks [#10031](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10031)
  - Properly mark secrets field as not required in swagger [#10038](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10038)
  - Disallow build config LastVersion from getting smaller - clients will receive a validation error if `status.latestVersion` is a smaller integer than the stored value [#9568](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9568)
- Secrets:
  - Secret data may now be specified in string form (rather than base64 encoded) via the new `stringData` map, which is write-only and takes precedence over keys with the same name specified in `data`  [#9663](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9663)
- PodSecurityPolicy Review API (alpha)
  - The review APIs have been updated to take a `PodTemplateSpec` struct instead of a `PodSpec` struct, so that annotations on the pod template can be validated. [#10007](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10007)

## Component updates
- Updated to Kubernetes [1.3.0](https://github.com/openshift/kubernetes/commit/283137936a498aed572ee22af6774b6fb6e9fd94) with patch set [Origin stable-20160804](https://github.com/openshift/kubernetes/commit/507d3a7b242634b131710cfdfd55e3a1531ffb1b)
  - Backported a number of 1.3.x fixes, including a serious regression in parallel pod start performance with [#10111](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10111)
- Updated to Docker distribution [2.4.0](https://github.com/openshift/docker-distribution/commit/596ca8b86acd3feebedae6bc08abf2a48d403a14) with patch set [5594335](https://github.com/openshift/docker-distribution/commit/559433598c7be9d30d6cfc5cad5b5dfdb686725c)

## Features

[v1.3.0-alpha.3](https://github.com/openshift/origin/tree/v1.3.0-alpha.3) (2016-08-07)
[Full Changelog](https://github.com/openshift/origin/compare/v1.3.0-alpha.2...v1.3.0-alpha.3)

### PetSets and Init Containers

Kubernetes 1.3 includes two new features in alpha designed for running clustered software: PetSets and init containers.  [PetSets](http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/petset/) make it easy to run a consistent set of pods that have individual network identities and are able to have unique persistent volumes.  [Init containers](http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/production-pods/#handling-initialization) are run sequentially before the other containers in a pod are started and allow pod authors to read and write volume data, download binaries, wait for other components to start, and other initialization style tasks.

The [examples/pets](https://github.com/openshift/origin/tree/master/examples/pets) directory contains a number of examples of how to use PetSets. As alpha features, no backwards compatibility in future Kubernetes or OpenShift versions is guaranteed and may change significantly.  Please provide feedback on these features.
- Enable petsets in origin [#9972](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9972)
- Enable security limits around init containers [#9973](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9973)

### Improvements to Jenkins

<ben TODO>
- clean up jenkins master/slave example [#9956](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9956)
- jenkins: Generate a password for Jenkins [#10163](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10163)
- jenkins: Use official maven image for slave pods in sample pipeline [#9807](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9807)
- console: addition of a dedicated Pipelines page
  ![pipelines_page](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1467629/17498811/9c373f7e-5d97-11e6-8502-7e21ff8ec1d0.png)
- console: improvements to the pipeline visualization on the Overview
  ![pipeline_overview](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1467629/17498819/aa453c7e-5d97-11e6-88af-a7a033bf93e0.png)

### Upgrading to Docker Registry 2.4, cross-repository linking, and better usage tooling

This release contains an upgrade to Docker distribution 2.4 which contains many performance and usability improvements, including cross repo mounting when pushing images that already exist in the OpenShift registry.  Support for the new schema2 storage format for images is now available, although it must be manually enabled in order to accept images pushed in the schema2 format (to preserve compatibility with older Docker versions).
- registry: Check pull access when tagging imagestreams [#10109](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10109)
- registry: Consider schema v2 layers when pruning [#9713](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9713)
- registry: User can get only blobs he's able to see [#9819](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9819)
- registry: Ensure that download access to registry blobs is controlled by access to the image stream [#9593](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9593)

#### Bearer token and anonymous access

The registry now supports the the [Docker Token Authentication Specification](https://docs.docker.com/registry/spec/auth/token/), which enables bearer token authentication and anonymous access. Grant the `system:image-puller` role to the `system:unauthenticated` group to allow unauthenticated image pulls from a namespace:

```
oc policy add-role-to-group system:image-puller system:unauthenticated -n mynamespace
```
- registry: Allow anonymous registry access [#9887](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9887)

#### Image usage reporting

A new top level administrative command `oadm top` has been added to support administrative insight into the images used by the platform.  Using `oadm top images` will show you information about the top images in use and how much space is in use in your registry.  `oadm top imagestreams` will show you more detail about the total referenced size of each image stream and the number of layers allocated.
- images: Provide an administrative image usage report tool [#9587](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9587)

```
$ oadm top imagestreams

sha256:97caf48a52438d60b567f25d5882c331c7c8d4679618b17b33ee8ec86c7ba5ec test/ruby (latest)          sha256:8c6c4ff3ae64a90ab1535a7ff33e685c63b3d51f7915722292c12e5ccb8f0a7f,sha256:212d8e093d50b44cf8dd3101d22e7efce6293d741a6dc30fced9cd27b70c7c22,sha256:e0ccc37251074051bb5d20a86756357bc261b87a6838a552e6304191dffdeed2,sha256:7b5846517492e69b6705c6f6a14f3eb0944bd564369439c539aa57882ea11c00,sha256:c605bcbb3b290d02a380cf0488effcdbb96fad1fcdd5a1d237fe44237f6d71cd,sha256:8b0055a02328f8d3d9e52112886e6f9272b880eee20ead761e631c3be2d37618,sha256:cc561897aa2c64d61fcda5b5149fbd1fca133ceb8cc8ac448859d571a2bdbbd8,sha256:b58b9ac6edd661668bafab79f10e24e20b4b1df3de77e010bea95cbfa59890cf,sha256:56f808f1bd2b820df6bef53d959f84bebd77ddd86fa86cef4e402d42a517d861,sha256:41da716a93a61a8958d360ac3f70387ece99af3ac4c3ce30dbb735dea41903dc,sha256:e7d7d97f75d94f0b79e68057b1c276c5b8c64d4a1d9a447dd59001521d8720bd,sha256:68a27d407fd1ead3b8a9e33aa2054c948ad3a54556d28bb4caaf704a0f651f96,sha256:ae121ac0828f1a1ddf3c1c84c67eb663933d60ee73617b8dfa0da5b095f1f9bb,sha256:453d96efdaa1bab5f7d115037235df965a292070a1c6a2af30cb049f5674848e,sha256:a08759ded47520de300096fea140e9020dc7ae9b7a163ec604baba38c15cd192,sha256:e757c402d95f047f2876e368271e9570b1904366ced49b6333f8a897b368e69d,sha256:091120a2f697d36898e3dde6fb5be64d694672111d78a77a340c827626f52f89,sha256:e87d875660454595a08287afe8bc121c924d87f93ea1db0f5ac12809d7473bb3,sha256:2375b645b83bff8ccf7e61346859cd9a23ac57af6d443b32b6392c1998d14c74,sha256:440bfdfabdd46b5cd18672e7354bf915384047bb074cd429c92db004095f3708,sha256:851ec2ace8a73a9cc3868edcbff1ac50d5f382d5079b7bfa4e7ff2bb531c171f,sha256:83c2fd8cc3258f1ec22f26b6f6c573460f43be28f7ab3073b912f7bc8b56d930,sha256:5a428b5b36d4cd98dce8603d5accb30ff014b7d4fb73c2bb895edda89cabbb3d,sha256:71ea884c14ff11865cec03c443ed9b887d35673e07122e7aea967b75e40b0f42,sha256:a54e1612052715b0d3022c8146ff758bd566455750f1391946648de767a74c5b Deployment: test/ruby-1 yes     156.09MiB
```

### Support all Deployment features on DeploymentConfigs and add the `oc rollout` command

Alpha 3 adds a ton of new capabilities onto deployments.  As of alpha 3, all options from Kubernetes Deployments are supported on deployment config objects, such as pausing, setting a "wait" period for readiness to stabilize after a deployment, and more information returned in the status of the deployment.  In addition, `oc rollout (history|pause|resume|undo)` now supports both Kubernetes deployments and OpenShift deployment configs.  Over time, `oc deploy` will be replaced by subcommands under `oc rollout` as Kubernetes deployments gain parity with OpenShift deployments.

Upstream deployments are now enabled for use (in beta) and future releases will add tools for easily converting between them (for when you want deployments that trigger on image changes or deployment hooks).  
- deployments: Return API errors on not found imagestreams/deploymentconfigs [#9727](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9727)
- Enabled deployments from Kubernetes as a beta resource - future releases will contain tools for migrating between resources.
- Add paused field in deployment config describer [#10159](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10159)
- deploy: pin retries to a const and forget correctly in the dc loop [#9756](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9756)
- deploy: set gracePeriodSeconds on deployer deletion [#9802](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9802)
- deploy: move cli-related packages in cmd [#9692](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9692)
- deployments: Ensure the test deployment invariant is maintained [#9839](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9839)
- deploy: set gracePeriod on deployer creation rather than when deleting [#9854](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9854)
- Add MinReadySeconds in deployment configs [#9852](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9852)
- deployments: Handle forbidden errors (due to older permissions) in oc rollback [#9889](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9889)
- Remove deployment trigger warning [#9894](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9894)
- Pause the deployment config before deleting [#9893](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9893)
- oc rollout
- deploy: enqueue configs on pod events [#9953](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9953)
- performance
- Enable replicasets and deployments [#10136](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10136)
- deployments: Collapse deployer into deployments controller [#9691](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9691)
- deployments: Specifying an empty initial image will hold the first deployment until an image is tagged [#9539](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9539)

### Support resizing remote terminals in the CLI (`oc exec|rsh|debug`) and the web console

The exec and attach commands (or more often used with `oc rsh`) are now resizable and correctly handle terminal information, which should improve working inside of containers.  The web console also allows the terminal to be resized.
- cli: Support terminal resizing for exec/attach/run [#9878](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9878)

### seccomp profiles for all containers and allow admin policy on their use

seccomp is a Linux kernel feature that restricts the types of system calls that applications can make.  Kubernetes and Docker have added profiles that prohibit access for containers by default and significantly reduce the possibility of new vulnerabilities in the kernel being exploited by malicious containers.  OpenShift enables this restrictive policy by default, and administrators can allow less restrictive profiles for highly privileged applications via the SecurityContextConstraint API.
- security: Enable seccomp in SecurityContextConstraints [#9715](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9715)

### Extended builds (alpha)
- Extended builds [#9813](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9813)

### Support for internal communication using Protobuf and general performance improvements

The Kubernetes and OpenShift APIs now support an alternate serialization format to JSON: [Protobuf]().  Protobuf is a binary format that requires less CPU and memory to encode and decode and offers significant benefits when internal components of the cluster are interacting.  Clients may request Protobuf responses by specifying an `Accept` HTTP header with the value `application/vnd.kubernetes.protobuf`.

```
$ curl -H "Accept: application/vnd.kubernetes.protobuf" https://localhost:8443/api/v1/pods | hexdump -C
```

By default, all cluster internal communication will use Protobuf, but it must be enabled via configuration.  Instructions for upgrading are described here: https://github.com/openshift/openshift-ansible/issues/2214.

The Protobuf format is considered internal-only at this point and is not recommended for widespread client use.
- Add protobuf to OpenShift types [#9793](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9793)
- Enable protobuf in Origin for server-to-server [#9814](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9814)

Other significant performance improvements occurred in this release, including a number of memory usage reductions in the API server and controllers.  

### Enhancements to the `imagebuilder` library

The imagebuilder library for building squashed Dockerfiles has added a secret mount facility that allows builds to mount in secrets for the duration of the build that are not committed into the final Docker image.  The `--mount SRC:DST` flag is now supported on `oc ex dockerbuild` and has the same behavior as `docker run -v`.  Mount secrets are only supported on Docker 1.10 or newer.
- Allow a mounted repository to be injected into yum [#9947](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9947)

In addition, the library has now been moved to its own GitHub repository at https://github.com/openshift/imagebuilder.
- Switch to using github.com/openshift/imagebuilder [#10216](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10216)

### Service Serving Cert Signer (alpha)

If your service needs to serve TLS as TLS enabled, OpenShift can automatically generate and sign a serving certificate that is valid for your service's DNS name.  The signing CA certificate is injected into pods, so any pod in the cluster can communicate with your service and confirm that it is properly secured.  See https://github.com/openshift/openshift-docs/pull/2324 for details.

### Scoped tokens for service accounts that act as OAuth clients

If your service needs to confirm the identity of a user on the OpenShift platform and/or perform actions on their behalf, you can now leverage our OAuth server to request scoped tokens for a user.  See https://docs.openshift.org/latest/architecture/additional_concepts/authentication.html#oauth for details.

### Support for quota that spans multiple projects and performance improvements (alpha)

If you need to constrain the number of resources that particular user can create, but don't want to restrict individual projects, you can create a new ClusterResourceQuota resource that can select multiple projects based on a labels or annotations.  See https://github.com/openshift/openshift-docs/pull/2596 for details.

A number of other performance improvements have been made to quota for clusters with thousands of individual quotas.
- add oc create clusterquota [#9588](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9588)
- project clusterresourcequota into applicable namespaces [#9609](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9609)
- add a clusterquota reconciliation controller [#9658](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9658)
- add project annotation selectors to cluster quota [#9757](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9757)
- make clusterquota/status endpoint [#9898](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9898)
- UPSTREAM: 29133: use a separate queue for initial quota calculation [#9915](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9915)
- perf improvements
- UPSTREAM: 29134: Improve quota controller performance [#9937](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9937)
- cluster quota to namespace mapping controller [#9558](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9558)
- UPSTREAM: 28351: Add support for kubectl create quota command [#10054](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10054)

### Allow template authors to provide a post-creation message to end users

Templates now have a `message` field that will be displayed to users in the CLI or web console after creating an object from a template. The field will have the same parameterization rules applied as the objects in the template, so you can inject generated fields into a human readable message.
- Adding a field to templates to allow them to deliver a user message w [#9708](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9708)
- Adding template instructional message to new-app output [#9806](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9806)

### Split traffic between multiple backend services from a route

The HAProxy router now supports splitting the traffic coming to a route across multiple back end services via weighting.  The web console has been updated to allow users to set the weighting and show balance between them.

The API field for balancing is `spec.alternateBackends` on the route and can be an array of 0..3 services to spread traffic across.  The weight of the normal backend (the `spec.to` field) defaults to 100, and the combined value of all the weights sets the relative proportions of traffic.
- routes: Add A/B definitions to routes [#9119](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9119)
- router: Allow round-robin algorithm as a choice in passthrough/reencrypt [#9710](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9710)
- console: visualization of alternate backends and ability to add and edit multiple backends for a route.

![ab_split](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1467629/17496027/7b614eb0-5d89-11e6-8512-3af7faca5b68.png)

### Router enhancements to defend against DDOS attacks

The router has been hardened to provide more protection against DDOS attacks.  Administrators can set configuration flags on the router to apply blanket policy on connections across all routes, as well as configure a few routes specifically.
- router: Implement basic DDOS protections in the HAProxy template router [#9810](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9810)
- router: Allow for configurable server side timeouts on routes [#9671](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9671)
- router: Allow rate-limits on the router to be defaulted [#10125](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10125)

### Egress Firewalls for namespaces

A new resource `EgressNetworkPolicy` has been added which controls how traffic exits a namespace.  Administrators can use these as outbound firewalls when using the multi-tenant SDN network.  Each rule can be an allow or deny rule, and targets a CIDR.  Since policy can only be changed by administrators, you can update your out of the box project template to include a firewall policy that applies to individual namespaces, and then later change to be more permissive.
- Egress firewall support [#9227](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9227) https://trello.com/c/iH5IjWI8/244-8-basic-egress-firewall

### Enable Kerberos authentication in the CLI

`oc login` now allows Kerberos authentication against a KDC as a supported authentication mode on Linux.
- Add krb5-devel to build release image [#9716](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9716)
- Load versioned gssapi libs [#9820](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9820)

### Web console improvements
- New primary and secondary navigation within a project
  ![primary_nav](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1467629/17495483/385a5d0c-5d87-11e6-888d-3acc31eb2733.png)
- Dedicated monitoring page to follows logs and metrics for your builds/deployments/pods all at once.  Includes a collapsable Events sidebar.  Includes improved metrics charts for deployments with individual lines per pod (up to 5 pods).
  ![monitoring_expanded_more_metrics](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1467629/17496086/aff147f2-5d89-11e6-9535-49f436c58c62.png)
- New page that shows the details for an ImageStreamTag
  ![image_stream_tag_page](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1467629/17499005/b1dbcace-5d98-11e6-8da0-8e5720b1bc2d.png)
- Added environment variable editing to the existing Environment tabs.
  ![environment_variable_editing](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1467629/17499140/96e596ea-5d99-11e6-8df7-79fd7c20e1af.png)

### New supported versions for popular languages

PostgreSQL 9.5, Ruby 2.3, Python 3.5, NodeJS 4, MariaDB 10.1, MongoDB 3.2
- add new SCL version imagestreams [#9610](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9610)
- add nodejs 4 imagestream and bump templates to use latest imagestreams [#9823](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9823)

### Generate `man` pages for all CLI commands

Man pages have been created for all CLI commands and added to the RPM packaging that include the command help.
- Fix manpage directory structure [#9612](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9612)
- Fix manpage formatting for list items [#9659](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9659)
- Remove deprecated man pages [#9694](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9694)

### CentOS PaaS Special Interest Group

OpenShift is involved in the [CentOS PaaS SIG](https://wiki.centos.org/SpecialInterestGroup/PaaS) and work is ongoing to enable a fast moving build stream in their CI infrastructure. See the QuickStart guide for some initial steps.
- Add Dockerfiles.centos7 and job-id files for CentOS image building [#9864](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9864)

### Other Features
- bootstrap: `oc cluster up` now starts the release corresponding to your binary [#10022](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10022)
- builds: Reduce the amount of output displayed by default in builds [#9905](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9905)
- builds: allow `git\_ssl\_no\_verify` env variable in build pods [#9875](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9875)
- cli: Allow multiple include and exclude patterns in `oc rsync` [#10146](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10146)
- cli: `oc new-project --skip-config-write` will not alter the user's config when creating a new project [#10057](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10057)
- cli: Include information about container volume mounts in `oc describe` for all pod based objects [#9891](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9891)
- cli: Display oc and kube server versions as part of oc version [#9785](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9785)
- cli: Display more information about environment variables using the downward API in 'oc env --list' [#9718](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9718)
- cli: Sort `oc projects` alphabetically [#9675](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9675)
- cli: Improve `oc projects` output [#9590](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9590)
- cli: Improve `oc status` output for all build types [#9559](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9559)
- dockercompose: Support the `env\_file` option when importing Docker compose files [#9950](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9950)
- frameworks: Add mirror env var option support for many of the framework images [#9754](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9754)
- images: Sort tags for image streams more consistently in the CLI [#9606](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9606)
- network: Allow CNI network plugins to be used as the node network plugin [#9747](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9747)
- newapp: Allow a template to be passed from STDIN via `oc new-app --template=-` [#10149](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10149)
- newapp: Support namespaced lookups for templates with `oc new-app --template=myns/mytemplate` [#10026](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10026)
- newapp: Allow multiline parameters to be defined on the CLI for templates [#9942](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9942)
- oauth: Control how OAuth grants are performed at a per-client granularity [#9616](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9616)
- server: Allow custom configuration to be passed to the scheduler for setting the default scheduler and failure domains [#10064](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10064)

## Bugs
- authn: The node should use the new remote authentication endpoint [#9808](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9808)
- authn: Add debug logging to ldap search bind errors [#9706](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9706)
- authn: Don't fallback to cert when given invalid token [#9617](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9617)
- bootstrap: Support shared volumes for `oc cluster up` on Mac and Windows [#10199](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10199)
- bootstrap: Handle filesystem permissions correctly in `oc cluster up` [#10137](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10137)
- bootstrap: Fix `oc cluster up` for new Docker for Mac beta by using port forwarding [#9809](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9809)
- builds: Run all parallel builds when a serial build finishes [#9969](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9969)
- builds: Handle new "already pushed" messages returned by Docker registries [#9966](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9966)
- builds: When build configs are deleted, exit out earlier in controllers [#9828](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9828)
- builds: Retry failed attempts to create builds on the server more cleanly [#9770](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9770)
- builds: Better s2i and docker push image error messages [#9705](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9705)
- cli: Allow `oc get -w` to correctly watch resources that have not been changed in a long time [#10213](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10213)
- cli: `oc debug` should not return an error if one of the containers in a pod exits (while the others continue) [#10175](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10175)
- cli: Ensure errors that occur during cleanup of `oc debug` are shown [#10140](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10140)
- cli: Fix `oc` to not try to fetch OpenShift API objects when connecting to a Kubernetes server [#10062](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10062)
- cli: On older servers tolerate missing API discovery information [#10058](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10058)
- cli: Better errors on `oc login` when existing kubeconfig file is not writable [#9968](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9968)
- cli: `oc start-build` should allow `-F` and `-w` for `--follow` and `--wait` [#9963](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9963)
- cli: Start `oc rsync` daemon in the foreground to prevent zombie processes [#9939](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9939)
- cli: `oc annotate` should allow use of `--resource-version` flag with single resource [#9917](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9917)
- cli: Add `--insecure-policy` for `oc create route edge` [#9890](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9890)
- cli: `oc debug` should not have 15s timeout [#9867](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9867)
- cli: Enforce `--tty=false` flag for "oc debug" [#9637](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9637)
- cli: Update generic `oc get` error messages to be more explicit when no input [#9735](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9735)
- cli: Don't attempt to rewrite kubeconfig files the user doesn't have access to [#9700](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9700)
- cli: Fix `oc convert` examples [#9695](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9695)
- cli: Fix usage for `oc set probe` and `oc debug` [#9693](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9693)
- cli: Reject build requests for binary builds if not providing binary inputs [#9679](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9679)
- cli: Better warning for users when the buildconfig is of type binary [#9678](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9678)
- cli: Ensure client can delete a buildconfig with no associated builds, eve [#9657](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9657)
- cli: Limit the number of events and deployments displayed in deployment config describer [#9633](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9633)
- cli: Allow `--show-events=false` for build configs and deployment configs [#9631](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9631)
- cli: Note that `oc new-app --env` flag doesn't apply to templates [#9583](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9583)
- cli: Fix `oc set env --overwrite=false` with multiple resources [#9552](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9552)
- dockercompose: Be more careful about relative paths in docker-compose import [#9816](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9816)
- images: Use the new `dockerImageLayers` field of images to speed up pruning images [#10012](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10012)
- ipfailover: Prevent panics if an invalid IP range is passed to the failover image [#10204](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10204)
- metrics: Remove redundant labels in Prometheus metrics [#10036](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10036)
- newapp: Prevent invalid arguments for build type in `oc new-app` [#9805](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9805)
- newapp: Display a warning if Git not installed when creating applications or builds [#10226](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10226)
- newapp: Give applications created from templates an `app` label based on their template name [#10192](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10192)
- newapp: When Git is not available, `oc new-app` should treat directories as inputs for binary builds [#10135](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10135)
- node: Network plugins could report the wrong `podIP` to clients [#10141](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10141)
- node: Report an error if older versions of devicemapper are in use which could lead to data corruption [#10227](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10227)
- quota: Quota was not counting services with multiple nodeports properly [#10089](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10089)
- registry: Set reasonable default resource requests on the registry [#9934](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9934)
- server: Tolerate failures when initializing default cluster roles and policies [#10099](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/10099)
- volumes: Ensure that persistent volumes with region and zone labels result in pods being properly scheduled for AWS / GCE [#9822](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9822)

## Release SHA256 Checksums

name: v1.2.1
body:
This is a security hotfix to Origin v1.2.x.  All users are recommended to upgrade to v1.2.1 who are on v1.2.0

## Bugs

[v1.2.1](https://github.com/openshift/origin/tree/v1.2.1) (2016-07-14)
[Full Changelog](https://github.com/openshift/origin/compare/v1.2.0...v1.2.1)
- Fix a security issue where some users can escalate privileges via the watch API.  Workaround: disable namespaced watch access to end users or limit the ability for untrusted users to access the API
- Correct an issue with how nodes are started up.

## Release SHA256 Checksums

486b7478d17a83dd18256ffcb55e56d10d2811d83f101f68e0ca973edd3ecf5f  openshift-origin-client-tools-v1.2.1-5e723f6-mac.zip
5c5e5d86ddcc940773da44f020355c380c669e58936f25a41afa800faf71b58c  openshift-origin-client-tools-v1.2.1-5e723f6-windows.zip
3215682df346fff7715557e99351f6c2a2c2d75944ac85a213426006dc373d0d  openshift-origin-image-v1.2.1-5e723f6-linux-64bit.tar.gz
0d61a749d742929d65d7557865de9f1a00daa400d9b748dfce7a91ad761db707  openshift-origin-server-v1.2.1-5e723f6-linux-64bit.tar.gz
