name: v1.3.0-alpha.2
body:
This is an alpha feature release towards OpenShift Origin 1.3.0.

## Backwards Compatibility

No changes.

## API Changes
- Updating the route spec.host field is now prohibited. You must create a new route with a new host - [#9325](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9325), [#8677](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/8677), [#9425](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9425)
- Allow deployments with an image change trigger to specify an empty string for their container image to force deployment to wait until the image become available [#9167](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9167)
- Make project watch work for namespace deletion [#9204](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9204)
- Add an API for checking whether pod templates would be allowed via the user's SecurityContextConstraints [#8941](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/8941)

## Component updates

None.

## Features

[v1.3.0-alpha.2](https://github.com/openshift/origin/tree/v1.3.0-alpha.2) (2016-06-20)
[Full Changelog](https://github.com/openshift/origin/compare/v1.3.0-alpha.1...v1.3.0-alpha.2)

### Jenkins Pipeline Improvements

The web console overhaul continues - this release more deeply embeds Jenkins pipeline, while also exposing more information about the state of your applications in summary form.  (to try it out yourself read [the example guide](https://github.com/openshift/origin/blob/master/examples/jenkins/pipeline/README.md))

![9720a0ad-80d8-4101-6d2b-2967e766bac9](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1163175/16216853/443feb44-373c-11e6-81b5-931463870bb7.png)

The build details page now shows a detailed breakdown of the stages in each build using the information provided by Jenkins.

![running-pipeline](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1163175/16216830/f9b2aa9e-373b-11e6-8376-cfa54d64af93.png)

Since the overview page looks best with metrics, you can now install cluster metrics with `oc cluster up --metrics` (you'll want an extra ~1GB of memory available for the full component set) [#9310](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9310)

### Other improvements
- authentication: Allow impersonation of groups as well as users [#9062](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9062)
- authentication: Mount a ca.crt into all pods that verifies auto-generated service secrets [#9044](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9044)
- builds: Simplify the amount of log output during a build [#8924](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/8924)
- builds: Simplify image progress reporting [#9212](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9212)
- builds: The builder service account is now allowed to push to non-existent image streams (which auto-creates the stream) [#9066](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9066)
- cli: Add a new command to list all projects, `oc projects` [#9199](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9199)
- cli: Add a new command to set build hooks on build configs, `oc set build-hooks` [#9194](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9194)
- cli: Add a new command to set deployment hooks on deployment configs, `oc set deployment-hooks` [#9187](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9187)
- cli: Add an experimental `openshift ex config patch` command to make modifying `master-config.yaml` easier [#9165](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9165)
- cli: In `oc cluster up`, if --public-hostname is an IP use it for server IP [#9103](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9103)
- cli: Add describe output for OAuth tokens [#9032](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9032)
- deployments: Allow deployment configs to be paused by setting the `paused` boolean to true [#9086](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9086)
- gitserver: allow specifying build strategy [#9031](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9031)
- import: Import app.json to OpenShift applications [#8819](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/8819)
- ipfailover: Add liveness and readiness probes for the ipfailover dc. [#9215](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9215)
- network: Allow the node to be configured to auto-detect the networking plugin in use via the API [#9147](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9147)
- performance: Enable the etcd watch cache for all OpenShift types [#9057](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9057)
- registry: Enable GCS storage for the registry [#9211](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9211)
- registry: atomic-registry via systemd [#9200](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9200)
- router: Add the both ROUTER_SERVICE*SNI_PORT [#9175](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9175)
- router: Make route name and namespace available to templates [#9159](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9159)

## Bugs
- builds: When multiple build configs target the image stream tag, display better output in `oc status` [#9308](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9308)
- builds: Make git cloning more tolerant to failures and retry at increasing intervals in the event the repository cannot eb cloned [#9124](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9124)
- builds: The new dockerbuild command should only pull the :latest image if no tag specified [#9104](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9104)
- builds: Validation message when updating builds was vague [#9164](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9164)
- cli: Scale command was improperly ignoring non-conflict errors, hiding real failures [#9228](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9228)
- cli: In `oc cluster up` print last 10 error lines on container failures [#9256](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9256)
- cli: --container-port actually work for expose [#9178](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9178)
- cli: `oc get --show-labels` was not correct for OpenShift resources [#9152](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9152)
- cli: Fix panic when describing some resources [#9097](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9097)
- cli: Warn during import docker-compose if a docker compose service has no ports [#9009](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9009)
- controllers: Retry service account update on conflict [#9250](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9250)
- deployments: Remove deployer pods when they are canceled - avoids leaving unscheduled pods around [#9291](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9291)
- deployments: Update deployment config image at most once when trigger automatic=false [#9096](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9096)
- deployments: Deployments in `oc deploy` were not listed correctly [#9196](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9196)
- deployments: If lastTriggeredImage was set when creating a deployment config, it could prevent the initial deployment [#9177](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9177)
- gitserver: allow anonymous access when using uid/pwd auth [#9125](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9125)
- images: Image stream tags that follow another tag were not being updated properly [#9258](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9258)
- images: Update DockerImageReferences when tagging across image streams [#9238](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9238)
- images: Fix import-image --all [#9163](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9163)
- ipfailover: IPFailover was broken for alpha.1 [#9102](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9102)
- ldap: Add validation to prevent filters on dn lookups [#9134](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9134)
- quota: Ensure that updates to pods correctly apply / revert quota charges [#9141](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9141)
- registry: Don't enforce quota in registry by default [#9400](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9400)
- router: Defend against slowloris attacks via a tunable ROUTER_SLOWLORIS_TIMEOUT environment variable [#9003](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/9003)

## Release SHA256 Checksums

```
e2eda88bdc734d0d4acd651e8b997fabea2d7ff0bce8bc2b48e728ea9b78e9ea  openshift-origin-client-tools-v1.3.0-alpha.2-983578e-linux-32bit.tar.gz
afff3f46c609758de1638d3979bdf2e2de80b61a877476dc46af5fb2e9403102  openshift-origin-client-tools-v1.3.0-alpha.2-983578e-linux-64bit.tar.gz
b1bbd0a96833300291ed35c1a120ad1d873b2845c09f2de3cc51b52d6a4525ae  openshift-origin-client-tools-v1.3.0-alpha.2-983578e-mac.zip
653673900e4c6bba2cd9571deab53be2d420956fd0042f63440f502c0a137120  openshift-origin-client-tools-v1.3.0-alpha.2-983578e-windows.zip
28bc86b5fc4658e8247e9ac6e4185d45c190d959c7b62cb3c0ffb0db202557d7  openshift-origin-server-v1.3.0-alpha.2-983578e-linux-64bit.tar.gz
```

name: v1.3.0-alpha.1
body:
This is an alpha feature release towards OpenShift Origin 1.3.0

## Backwards Compatibility
- Origin now must be compiled on Go 1.6 or newer. Support for building and testing against Go 1.4 has been removed.
- The `v1beta3` API is now no longer supported.  Any cluster that is using v1beta3 resources should immediately upgrade them, as all support will be dropped for 1.3.0

## API Changes
- Support watch on projects [#8755](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/8755)

## Component updates
- Updated to Kubernetes [1.3.0-alpha.1-331](https://github.com/openshift/kubernetes/commit/bf0e6e0047c10724c393dd0379f15c1675689c01) with patch set [Origin stable-20160411](https://github.com/openshift/kubernetes/commit/c2cc7fd2eafe14472098737b2c255ce4ca06d987)
- Updated to etcd v2.3.0

## Features

[v1.3.0-alpha.1](https://github.com/openshift/origin/tree/v1.3.0-alpha.1) (2016-05-24)
[Full Changelog](https://github.com/openshift/origin/compare/v1.3.0-alpha.0...v1.3.0-alpha.1)

### Spin up local clusters easily with `oc cluster up`

This new command makes it easy to launch a new cluster inside of a Docker container.  The command will use your existing Docker connection by default to launch the container, ensuring all the preconditions for a simple all-in-one server are in place before starting the server.  It will then install the router, registry, default image streams, and standard templates before creating a user account for you.

```
$ oc cluster up
-- Checking Docker client ... OK
-- Checking for existing OpenShift container ... OK
-- Checking for openshift/origin:3c2e3b2 image ... OK
-- Checking Docker daemon configuration ... OK
-- Checking for available ports ... OK
-- Checking type of volume mount ... 
   Using nsenter mounter for OpenShift volumes
-- Checking Docker version ... OK
-- Creating volume share ... OK
-- Finding server IP ... 
   Using 172.18.0.96 as the server IP
-- Starting OpenShift container ... 
   Creating initial OpenShift configuration
   Starting OpenShift using container 'origin'
   Waiting for API server to start listening
   OpenShift server started
-- Installing registry ... OK
-- Installing router ... OK
-- Importing image streams ... OK
-- Importing templates ... OK
-- Login to server ... OK
-- Creating initial project "myproject" ... OK
-- Server Information ... 
   OpenShift server started.
   The server is accessible via web console at:
       https://172.18.0.96:8443

   You are logged in as:
       User:     developer
       Password: developer

   To login as administrator:
       oc login -u system:admin

$ oc status
```

You can use the `--version=v1.2.0` flag to select an alternate image to use.

### Jenkins Pipeline integration

A core goal of any application platform must be to help developers manage change in their applications (after all, if it's not changing there probably aren't any developers).  As part of OpenShift Origin 1.3 we are deeply integrating Jenkins as a Service to bring developers an out of the box, easy to consume CI and CD pipeline.

The first pieces of this integration have been delivered via integration with OpenShift builds.  When you start a `Jenkinsfile` build type (which is new) a Jenkins instance will be spun up in your project that will execute the build using the Jenkins 2.0 pipeline and Jenkinsfile checked into your Git repo.

```
$ oc cluster up
$ oc new-project pipelineproject
$ oc new-app -f https://raw.githubusercontent.com/openshift/origin/master/examples/jenkins/pipeline/jenkinstemplate.json
```

You should see your Jenkins instance spun up in the web console, and then be able to jump into the web console via the router.  At this point you'll need to perform some manual steps to enable things in Jenkins - see https://github.com/openshift/origin/blob/master/examples/jenkins/pipeline/README.md for more.

There is a ton of exciting work with CI/CD in the works - stay tuned!

### Automatically sync local changes to the server with `oc rsync --watch` [#8268](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/8268)

`oc rsync` now supports a --watch flag which will cause it to continuously monitor the local filesystem and sync changes to the pod as they occur.  This makes it easy to work from an editor or IDE and have those changes show up live in your pods.

### Build run policy - serial, parallel, or latest-only [#8453](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/8453)

The build run policy describes the order in which the builds created from a build configuration should run.  There are several out of the box policies:
- Serial - runs each build in the order they were created (the new default)
- Parallel - start builds as soon as they are created (was the previous default)
- SerialLatestOnly - if multiple builds have been created when the last build completes, only build the latest and mark the older ones as skipped

You can change the build policy via the `spec.runPolicy` field on build configurations.

### Improving custom deployments [#8787](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/8787)

Custom deployments can now reuse the existing build logic but install custom hooks in any image you want.  See [this mailing list post](http://lists.openshift.redhat.com/openshift-archives/dev/2016-May/msg00037.html) for more details.

In addition, the output of deployments has been greatly streamlined:

```
$ oc logs dc/custom
--> pre: Running hook pod ...
my hook pod ran
--> pre: Success
--> Scaling deployment-2 from 0 to 5
    Scaling deployment-2 up to 3
    Scaling deployment-1 down to 2
--> Scaling deployment-2 from 3 to 5
    Scaling deployment-2 up to 5
    Scaling deployment-1 down to 0
--> Success
```

### Importing docker-compose.yaml files (Experimental)

This release includes an experimental command `oc import docker-compose` that can convert a docker-compose.yaml file into the Kubernetes and OpenShift equivalent, setting up your build pipelines on the cluster as well as all of the deployment artifacts.  It can even identify when containers should be colocated into pods so you can leverage local disk and local network.

```
$ git clone https://github.com/docker-library/docs.git
$ oc import docker-compose -f wordpress/docker-compose.yml
```

OpenShift will warn you if any machine specific or Docker specific concepts that don't translate well to a containerized cluster are being used.

Note that many compose files may assume they can run as root - if you are trying out a new compose application on OpenShift you may want to grant access to run as root to get things working:

```
$ oadm policy add-scc-to-user anyuid -z default 
```

Please experiment with this feature and open issues if things don't work quite right - we want to make it as easy as possible to bring your containerized applications to OpenShift!

### Squashed docker builds (Experimental)

Dockerfiles create an image **layer** for each instruction. However, these extra layers take time to commit and are often not useful when deploying applications in production.  This release of OpenShift adds a new `oc ex dockerbuild` command that processes a Dockerfile like the `docker build` command, but skips committing layers in between each instruction in the Dockerfile. This can lead to significant speed ups in build times and smaller image sizes.

```
$ oc ex dockerbuild . myimage:latest
```

This feature is experimental while we ensure it has compatibility with `dockerbuild`. In future releases it will be possible to launch Docker builds on OpenShift that use this feature to squash the built output by default.

To see it in action, check out the OpenShift Origin images on the hub:

```
$ docker history openshift/origin:v1.3.0-alpha.1
IMAGE               CREATED             CREATED BY                                      SIZE                COMMENT
de3ae06bc719        47 minutes ago      sleep 86400                                     138.1 MB            
8cf7dbcd9db7        7 hours ago         /bin/sh -c #(nop) LABEL io.k8s.display-name=O   0 B                 
39788598877c        7 hours ago         /bin/sh -c INSTALL_PKGS="which git tar wget h   78.58 MB            
ec3ffe3554ef        7 hours ago         /bin/sh -c yum update -y nss openssl-libs &&    1.671 MB            
60d7ec21aa96        8 days ago          /bin/sh -c #(nop) CMD ["/bin/bash"]             0 B                 
f0e1cf3be051        8 days ago          /bin/sh -c #(nop) LABEL name=CentOS Base Imag   0 B                 
ebe253abc97d        8 days ago          /bin/sh -c #(nop) ADD file:deb8ef25b4d805246a   196.7 MB            
1544084fad81        8 months ago        /bin/sh -c #(nop) MAINTAINER The CentOS Proje   0 B  
```

### Security

#### Scoped Access Tokens [#8393](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/8393)

Allows the creation of a token that identifies as the user, but only allows a subset of the user's permissions.  Scopes are restrictive, so a viewer who makes a scoped token with edit rules still only has view rights.  A common use for scoped tokens is to give to a third party the ability to act on your behalf (like a build systems) via the API, but to limit what they can actually do.

Scopes include (but are not limited to)
- `user:info` - gives information about who I am
- `user:check-access` - see what I can do
- `role:edit:my-ns` (token has the edit role in the `my-ns` namespace)

#### Impersonation [#8672](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/8672), [#8824](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/8824)

Allows a user with the "impersonate" permission on a particular user or serviceaccount, the ability to make a request "as" that other person.  A `sudoer` role was added to allow a user to impersonate "system:admin" so they don't have to have cluster-admin rights all the time.

Delete a project as the cluster admin

```
$ oc delete project/foo --as system:admin
```

Retrieve pods for the current project as the default service account

```
$ oc get pods --as system:serviceaccount:my-ns:default
```

#### Allowing Service Accounts to act as OAuth clients [#8878](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/8878)

Some containers in a cluster may want to provide services for end users or other containers.  Our standard solution for that is OAuth, but it's often difficult to make an OAuth client as a regular user.  This feature enables all service accounts to act as OAuth clients, where the secret of the client is the same as the service account token.  When a service account tries to request tokens, those tokens will be scoped to the service account namespace.

#### Add a simple audit record [#8815](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/8815)

OpenShift will now log audit information about requests made to the API server to the default logger when the config flag `auditConfig.enabled` is set to `true`.  This includes the user, their action, and whether it succeeded or not.

#### Other security changes
- Improve provider selection page [#8286](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/8286)
- add system:image-auditor [#8455](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/8455)
- add oc create policybinding [#8428](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/8428)
- add what-can-i-do endpoint [#8675](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/8675)
- Add create helpers for users, identities, and mappings from the CLI [#8715](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/8715)
- Add grant_type=password support to GitLab/OpenID identity providers [#8732](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/8732)
- do not force drop KILL cap on anyuid SCC [#8621](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/8621)
- Default role reconciliation to additive-only [#8603](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/8603)
- Add reconcile protection for roles [#8774](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/8774)
- allow project request limits on system users and service accounts [#8766](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/8766)
- Separate build strategy permissions into distinct roles [#8528](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/8528)

### Other improvements
- Allow a user to pass --as-user or --as-root=false to oc debug to control who to run as - [#8929](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/8929)
- Specify an `istag` to `oc debug` to create a new pod from an image [#8742](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/8742)
- Add `oc set volume` support for configmaps [#8720](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/8720)
- Add `oc create deploymentconfig` [#8712](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/8712)
- Add the service load balancer controller so that cloud providers can create services of type `LoadBalancer` [#8633](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/8633)
- Enable webhooks with multiple sources [#8580](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/8580)
- Allow `oc new-app` params to contain template replacements to make creating templates easier [#8535](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/8535)
- Improve `oc cancel-build` command [#8509](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/8509)
- Add option to reverse buildchains [#8460](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/8460)
- Allow parameters on generic webhook build trigger call [#8477](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/8477)
- Add labels and annotations from buildrequest to resulting build [#8405](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/8405)
- `oc describe build` output improvements [#8293](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/8293)
- `oc rsh` now supports specifying `deploymentconfig` or `replicationcontroller` to make it easier to get into a pod [#8279](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/8279)

## Bugs

Lots of improvements to how deployments are processed, cutting latency and reducing spurious warnings and messages:
- Fix timing issue scaling deployments [#8763](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/8763)
- Make the trigger controllers cooperate instead of race [#8746](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/8746)
- Prevent deployer pod creation conflicts [#8588](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/8588)
- deployment controller: cancel deployers on new cancelled deployments [#8418](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/8418)
- deployer controller: ensure phase direction [#8417](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/8417)
- Bug 1338679: emit events on failure to create a deployer pod [#8978](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/8978)
- Ensure that deployments trigger from the latest image change trigger value when the first deployment runs [#8892](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/8892)
- Bug 1329138: stop emitting events on update conflicts [#8652](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/8652)
- Prevent concurrent deployer pod creation [#8478](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/8478)

Other fixes:
- Prevent a panic when proxying the Kubernetes API (when running on top of Kubernetes) [#8896](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/8896)
- Prevent concurrent modification to router config that may not include all routes [#8893](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/8893)
- Remove gaps from build chart for deleted builds [#8804](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/8804)
- Remove the old deployments resource from roles [#8783](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/8783)
- PLEG: reinspect pods that failed prior inspections [#8778](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/8778)
- Show newlines and links in template descriptions in the web console [#8769](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/8769)
- Disable UI scaling for in progress deployment [#8761](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/8761)
- Clarify 'oc delete' help info, add 'oc delete all -l app=appName' example [#8757](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/8757)
- Increase default web console log line limit to 5000 [#8697](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/8697)
- Block s2i from doing ONBUILD operations [#8679](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/8679)
- Handle null items array from bad api responses [#8662](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/8662)
- Add openshift.io/deployer-pod.type label [#8632](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/8632)
- HAProxy Cookie ID should not provide info about the underlying software [#8615](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/8615)
- Improve parsing of semantic version for git tag [#8608](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/8608)
- Remove deprecated --nodes flag [#8598](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/8598)
- All image references should be using full semantic version [#8592](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/8592)
- Add default resource requests to router creation [#8495](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/8495)
- Support path routes with port number in Host header [#8490](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/8490)
- Enforce overview scaling rules for deployments without a service [#8476](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/8476)
- Enable recursive resolution of DNS to be consistent with upstream Kubernetes and support MUSL based images [#8474](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/8474)
- Read insecure annotation on an image stream when import-image is invoked [#8456](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/8456)
- Remove prompts from commented examples [#8454](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/8454)
- Improve wording in sample-app README [#8445](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/8445)
- Add ability to specify allowed CNs for RequestHeader proxy client cert [#8443](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/8443)
- Add flag to disable dynamic provisioning [#8426](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/8426)
- UPSTREAM: 23894: OOM errors when processes exit rapidly [#8412](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/8412)
- UPSTREAM: 23793: Make ConfigMap volume readable as non-root [#8411](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/8411)
- git server: add documentation and enable build start on push [#8394](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/8394)
- UPSTREAM: 23746: A pod never terminated if a container image registry was unavailable [#8378](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/8378)
- Display a relevant error message when hostname is missing [#8369](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/8369)
- Add basic validation for route TLS configuration - checks that input is "syntactically" valid. [#8366](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/8366)
- Set service account correctly in oadm registry, deprecate --credentials [#8296](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/8296)
- builds: use proxy specified in source strategy environment for s2i script download [#8265](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/8265)
- networking: Add a mutex to registry.podsByIP
- networking: Handle race conditions in the host IP allocator
- networking: Ignore malformed IP in Node object
- networking: Simplify ID management and prevent leaks

## Release SHA256 Checksums

```
e0ae0da9a33d131daae156d5e58d68617114f4cfaf26431d125c015785b654dd  openshift-origin-client-tools-v1.3.0-alpha.1-6e83535-linux-32bit.tar.gz
5afc5d9eebe10c2dc909547ed6b7ec4808416972e234bbd4c7be1fdd8ed0548d  openshift-origin-client-tools-v1.3.0-alpha.1-6e83535-linux-64bit.tar.gz
681d7867086a1da1c6548d6bb4042a7da785277eb7eac60da63a26bc12374254  openshift-origin-client-tools-v1.3.0-alpha.1-6e83535-mac.zip
d5f2a8533822e7313805004392b8866854eae73caf008bb88ca762d32e0fcab7  openshift-origin-client-tools-v1.3.0-alpha.1-6e83535-windows.zip
78a7fb09a2f240ac30bfce486e6b91810e4ebbef059683226695faeb858887c1  openshift-origin-server-v1.3.0-alpha.1-6e83535-linux-64bit.tar.gz
```

name: v1.2.0
body:
This is the the official release of OpenShift Origin 1.2.

[v1.2.0](https://github.com/openshift/origin/tree/v1.2.0) (2016-05-24)
[Full Changelog](https://github.com/openshift/origin/compare/v1.2.0-rc2...v1.2.0)

## Docker 1.9 / 1.10 and Origin

OpenShift Origin 1.2 depends on Docker 1.9.  As a consequence of the recent change to the DockerHub to stop supporting pull-by-digest for images pushed by newer Docker clients, users of OpenShift running Docker 1.10 may experience problems pulling images from the Hub.  We are working on addressing this issue in an upcoming patch release.

## Fixed Bugs
- Ensure that the router locks access to the internal map before generating config, to prevent race conditions [#8993](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/8993)
- Prevent users from mutating the status of PVCs and PVs - Kubernetes [#24924](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/24924)
- Enabling the etcd watch cache resulted in watch timeout errors being reported differently, causing issues for the web console - Kubernetes [#25369](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/25369)
- Importing images that had previously failed to import could result in occasional panics - [#8599](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/8599)
- Remove the possibility of console CSRF issues via the API proxy - [#8958](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/8958)

## Release SHA256 Checksums

```
8e903e6a81e9a8415532c6d7fbc86ab4c84818a4dad8fcf118776fa90424e95c  openshift-origin-client-tools-v1.2.0-2e62fab-linux-32bit.tar.gz
62d309592b27e42a84102a950d92a8c1b6b61ea488f7c2f3433bf38f64cea68b  openshift-origin-client-tools-v1.2.0-2e62fab-linux-64bit.tar.gz
a911c918426fd474330d60c5ec651308385b54fd0f0866e888328f38d8ee7671  openshift-origin-client-tools-v1.2.0-2e62fab-mac.zip
3df3d7f31d5f50fa49f94312883107ebee1a0877b598eada32dce1b029f6c3f2  openshift-origin-client-tools-v1.2.0-2e62fab-windows.zip
f6e46dec27f166a7f05554bd6b9364cead8c36a39836f75e16e16ee29b9e1a2f  openshift-origin-server-v1.2.0-2e62fab-linux-64bit.tar.gz
```

name: v1.2.0-rc1
body:
This is the first release candidate for OpenShift Origin 1.2

[v1.2.0-rc1](https://github.com/openshift/origin/tree/v1.2.0-rc1) (2016-04-20)
[Full Changelog](https://github.com/openshift/origin/compare/v1.1.6...v1.2.0-rc1)

## Changes requiring administrative action
- Separate build strategy permissions into distinct roles [#8528](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/8528). Admins who have denied access to docker, source, or custom builds will now need to assign users or groups to those roles by default.

## Component Updates
- Updated openshift-sdn to 9f1f6025 to address a panic and reuse of pod IPs [#8468](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/8468)

## Features
- Improve the output of `oc describe build` [#8293](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/8293)

## Fixed Bugs
- Performance: Enable the etcd watch cache for Kube resources, reducing memory use and duplicate watches [#8395](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/8395)
- Change RunOnce pod duration restrictor to act as a limit instead of override [#8304](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/8304)
- Guarantee partially completed builds are cleaned up when cancelled [#8306](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/8306)
- Check claimRef UID when processing a recycled PV to prevent races [#8100](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/8100)
- Build config edit form should be marked dirty when deleting environment variables [#8380](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/8380)
- ProjectRequestLimit plugin: ignore projects in terminating state [#8400](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/8400)
- Make ConfigMap volume readable as non-root [#8411](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/8411)
- Memory leak: Wrap oauth/login requests to clear in-memory session [#8435](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/8435)
- Add system:image-auditor role for managing image registry [#8455](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/8455)
- UPSTREAM: 23894: OOM errors when processes exit rapidly [#8412](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/8412)
- Allow dynamic volume provisioning to be disabled [#8426](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/8426)
- Deployment pods should be cancelled when deployments are cancelled in all cases new cancelled deployments [#8418](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/8418)
- Deployer controller should ensure deployments that are cancelled can't become completed [#8417](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/8417)
- Prevent concurrent deployer pod creation [#8478](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/8478)
- A pod would never terminate if the registry it pulls images from was unavailable [#8378](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/8378)
- Fix precision of cpu to millicore and memory to Mi in the UI [#8409](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/8409)
- HAProxy router should obfuscate the pod IP in when using cookies for session affinity [#8334](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/8334)

name: v1.2.0-rc2
body:
This is the second release candidate for OpenShift Origin 1.2

[v1.2.0-rc2](https://github.com/openshift/origin/tree/v1.2.0-rc2) (2016-04-25)
[Full Changelog](https://github.com/openshift/origin/compare/v1.2.0-rc1...v1.2.0-rc2)

## Component Updates
- Updated openshift-sdn to ba3087af to address a race condition assigning pod IPs in the multi tenant plugin [#8614](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/8614)

## Fixed Bugs
- Retry import of images from the DockerHub when receiving a 401 Unauthorized in the first attempt to download the image, due to a race condition in the DockerHub [#8574](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/8574) and [#8612](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/8612)
- Prevent incorrect quota allocation of pods when deployments conflict and the user is close to their quota limit by fetching the latest state first [#8588](https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/8588)

name: v1.1.6
body:
This is a bug fix release on top of Origin 1.1.x and is the first release candidate (rc1) for 1.2.0

## Component updates
- Updated to Kubernetes 1.2.1

## Features
- Support multiple web login providers
- Distinguish pods being pulled or terminating in the pod status output, and show the size of images with other pod info
- Improve the layout and display of logs in the web console
- Show a prettier router error page when an app doesn't exist yet

## Fixed Bugs
- PVC should not be blocked by the default SCC policy for users
- Continue to support host ports on `oadm router`, user can disable them with `--host-ports=false` when `--host-network=false` is also set.
- Emit events when cancellation of a deployment fails
- When invoking a binary build, retry if the input image stream tag does not exist yet (since it may be in the process of being imported)
- Fix a race condition in Kubernetes where endpoints might be partially updated (only have some pods) when the controller is restarted
- Docker containers do not allow CPU quota less than `10m`, so set the minimum value
- Don't sync daemonsets that match all pods.
- `oc new-build` should not fail when creating a binary build on a Git repo that doesn't have an upstream remote set
- Fix a race condition between scaled up routers where some changes might be ignored

## Release SHA256 Checksums
