name: v0.4.2
body:
Changes this release:
- Console now runs on port 8443
- Admin commands now available under `openshift admin *`
- Configuration of the OpenShift master and nodes can now be read from disk - see --write-config on `openshift start` and the `create-*` commands under `openshift admin`
- Initial support for the v2 Docker registry has been added - OpenShift can now boot a v2 registry to serve image pulls by Id.  Still waiting on Docker 1.6 to force everyone over to this new model.
- Improvements and cleanup to `osc login` and `osc project` to make them faster
- DNS support for services
  - All services now get a DNS name from the masters of `<servicename>.<namespace>.local`
  - The A record for each service is the service PortalIP
  - Subdomain queries on the service name also resolve as A records.
- Builds
  - Better build log handling
  - Include the start and end times for build
- Added NodeJS cartridge

[Full Changelog](https://github.com/openshift/origin/compare/v0.4.1...v0.4.2)

**Implemented enhancements:**
- console doesn't show hostport for pod - only containerport [#948](https://github.com/openshift/origin/issues/948)
- Builds should have more human-friendly names [#528](https://github.com/openshift/origin/issues/528)
- Builds should have an incrementing build number when generated from a build config [#333](https://github.com/openshift/origin/issues/333)

**Fixed bugs:**
- Security filter should output standard json error when hitting /api and /osapi [#1421](https://github.com/openshift/origin/issues/1421)
- TestSecondDeploymentFailedInitialRetries flaked [#1371](https://github.com/openshift/origin/issues/1371)
- osc describe "never" returns data [#1364](https://github.com/openshift/origin/issues/1364)
- `osc project` doesn't check context first [#1349](https://github.com/openshift/origin/issues/1349)
- 'osc login' displays no help options [#1348](https://github.com/openshift/origin/issues/1348)
- quota not being enforced [#1283](https://github.com/openshift/origin/issues/1283)
- "openshift ex login" fails with "unknown flag: --certificate-authority" [#1249](https://github.com/openshift/origin/issues/1249)
- UI: don't respawn many websockets on failure indefinitely [#1171](https://github.com/openshift/origin/issues/1171)
- kube proxy not handling OpenShift master restarts [#1126](https://github.com/openshift/origin/issues/1126)
- Build logs for completed builds are broken [#1115](https://github.com/openshift/origin/issues/1115)
- Inconsistent behaviour when creating template: components (rc or template or pod) are not always created [#1084](https://github.com/openshift/origin/issues/1084)
- Integration tests are failing intermittently on build failure [#865](https://github.com/openshift/origin/issues/865)
- Host System self-referencing requires FQDN to resolve (correctly) [#268](https://github.com/openshift/origin/issues/268)
- Invalid flag handling message needs work [#134](https://github.com/openshift/origin/issues/134)

**Closed issues:**
- osc describe build mybuild-1 should show buildConfig it was generated from [#1489](https://github.com/openshift/origin/issues/1489)
- If the port is not specified in the for --public-master it will default to 8443, even if the scheme is explicitly declared [#1482](https://github.com/openshift/origin/issues/1482)
- Router doesn't start if there are no child processes for Wait [#1434](https://github.com/openshift/origin/issues/1434)
- Using yaml for templates instead of Json [#1425](https://github.com/openshift/origin/issues/1425)
- running openshift on localhost with auth proxy makes kubelet queries impossible [#1424](https://github.com/openshift/origin/issues/1424)
- Unify describers for Build and BuildConfig for common fields [#1418](https://github.com/openshift/origin/issues/1418)
- osc describe locks up with new binary [#1410](https://github.com/openshift/origin/issues/1410)
- Auto generated node kubeconfigs have null server value [#1393](https://github.com/openshift/origin/issues/1393)
- openshift admin create-server-cert stutters [#1357](https://github.com/openshift/origin/issues/1357)
- "osc login" generates bad .config file [#1356](https://github.com/openshift/origin/issues/1356)
- running all-in-one openshift on localhost: lots of 403 [#1352](https://github.com/openshift/origin/issues/1352)
- config - create certificates and users for.... [#1337](https://github.com/openshift/origin/issues/1337)
- config - write out bootstrap roles and role bindings [#1336](https://github.com/openshift/origin/issues/1336)
- config - resolve relative file references relative to the master and node config files [#1335](https://github.com/openshift/origin/issues/1335)
- Docker image registry client not locating images for new-app [#1286](https://github.com/openshift/origin/issues/1286)
- "openshift ex" commands trigger the SkyDNS port configuration logic [#1285](https://github.com/openshift/origin/issues/1285)
- [RFE] support "additive" scripts for STI process [#1279](https://github.com/openshift/origin/issues/1279)
- [custom build] image isn't getting custom environment variables that are set [#1272](https://github.com/openshift/origin/issues/1272)
- curl to Kube API not working starting with v.0.4 [#1271](https://github.com/openshift/origin/issues/1271)
- no errors when logging to console using non-existent usernames/passwords [#1268](https://github.com/openshift/origin/issues/1268)
- Portal's are not namespaced [#1261](https://github.com/openshift/origin/issues/1261)
- test-integration.sh not required anymore in make test [#1255](https://github.com/openshift/origin/issues/1255)
- Openshift router pod (docker container) doesn't reap zombie processes [#1242](https://github.com/openshift/origin/issues/1242)
- sample app still uses ruby-20-centos and not centos7 [#1151](https://github.com/openshift/origin/issues/1151)
- Cannot install docker registry on a cluster with master and one minion [#1123](https://github.com/openshift/origin/issues/1123)

name: v0.4.1
body:
Changes this release:
- Rebased on top of Kube 0.11
- Allow log streaming when starting a build - `osc start-build ... --follow`
- Fix bugs with Dockerfile parsing on Docker builds
- Enable admission control for quota and limits by default
  - Administrators can set limits by creating a limits object in a namespace (see [limiting](https://github.com/GoogleCloudPlatform/kubernetes/blob/master/docs/design/admission_control_limit_range.md) and [quota](https://github.com/GoogleCloudPlatform/kubernetes/blob/master/docs/design/admission_control_resource_quota.md) design docs
- Systemd notification support on startup
- Lots of little cleanup to access control checks (more secure by default)

name: v0.4 - beta2
body:
Changes:
- Authorization enforcement by default
- NodeList default improvements (https://github.com/openshift/origin/issues/1161)

name: v0.3.4
body:
Just a quick release to resolve a few bugs before the upcoming Kubernetes rebase.

Changes:
- htpasswd fixes
- Build improvements for the router image
- passing `--images` was broken briefly in v0.3.3
- The web UI now links routes and services

This is a minor release just before our next Kubernetes rebase.

Notable Changes include:
- Multiple tags for the same image is now supported in ImageRepositories
- New liveness probe for the router
- Lots of polish to the CLI examples in the osc output
- Builds are now grouped by BuildConfig in the UI.  More details are shown as well
- Used vs Max quota are now properly compared in the in the web console
- Web console improvements for autoupdated timestamps
- Build output is now optional
- `openshift ex generate` now correctly handles Dockerfiles that expose multiple ports
- `openshift ex generate`'s _--ports_ flag was change to _--port_
- Improvements to the rollback CLI to make is easier to select a specific version.
- lots of policy enhancements
- Bug [1194487](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1194487) - Fix generate command repository detection
- Add htpasswd SHA/MD5 support for Origin v2 compatibility.  This is the simplest way to test try out the new policy enhancements.
- _master_ and _public-master_ .kubeconfig contexts are now created to simplify Node configuration (you now pass in `--kubeconfig` on Node startup instead of relying on an environment file)
- Human friendly build names
- CLI support for creating the internal registry: `openshift ex registry --create --credentials="${KUBECONFIG}"`
- New 'Deny' password authenticator (useful for secure out of the box deployments)
- https://trello.com/c/3nimYd3l/426-3-reuse-previously-built-artifacts-build-beta2

name: v0.3.2
body:
Changes:
- Both project access control and the majority of the new policy rule support is now implemented
  - Mandatory authorization will be enabled in v0.3.3
  - Projects are now virtual resources on top of the namespace resource
- The list of projects a user can see now obeys the access control rules defined by the policy - only projects you have access to will be usable by you
- `openshift ex policy` now allows most of the policy features to be controlled
- `openshift ex new-project` allows you to easily create a project and assign an administrator
- `openshift ex router` makes it easy to install a new default router or additional routers as services
- Templates can now be stored / retrieved / viewed from the server, for others to consume
  - `osc create -f examples/sample-app/application-template-stibuild.json` will now upload the template to the server
  - `osc describe template sample-app` will show details of that template
  - Set descriptions on templates via the `description` annotation
- Templates can now parameterize labels onto the objects they create
- A "contextDir" can now be set during STI builds if you want to build from a location in your source repository that is not the root
- Quota and limit support has been enabled, but is not yet enforced
- The console more cleanly supports the complex edge cases and behaviors around services and deployments and pods and how they can overlap or fit together with label selection

NOTE: There are some known performance optimizations still to be made in the policy / project / access engine, so high GC and CPU use when projects are added or dropped is expected.  Total memory usage should not be affected.

name: v0.3.1
body:
This is a point release after 0.3

Changes since 0.3:
- Policy work continues, adding more flexibility to the rules and setting the default roles
  - 0.4 will enable authz by default
- Support `OPENSHIFT_LOGOUT_URI` to change the URL the UI will send you to logout.
- Begin associating pods in the web console with the services that select them
- Show quota and limits from the project settings page in the console
- Use Kube v1beta3 in the console
- Added an edge terminated route to the sample app

name: v0.3 - beta1
body:
This is beta1 of OpenShift 3.0.

Changes since 0.2.2:
- We have added two commands for creating applications
  -  `osc new-app` targeted simple applications composed of images and source code
  - `openshift ex generate` which is a more powerful and flexible tool for creating applications from a source repo or a single image
- Revised and cleaned up the OpenShift CLI help to make it easier to read
- OpenShift now supports running on top of an existing Kubernetes
  - The OpenShift Master can run in a pod and connect to Kubernetes via the `--kubernetes=<addr>` and `--kubeconfig=<file>` arguments
  - The `/api` endpoint on the master will apply access control rules based on your policy and then proxy you to the Kubernetes master, meaning that OpenShift can control access to the cluster
- Authorization for individual users can be controlled via the `openshift ex policy` commands, which allow you to create policies that limit access to cluster resources by role to cluster resources.
- You can run `openshift ex login` to authenticate to the cluster and set an access token into your local `.kubeconfig` file
- Lots of updates to the UI including label selector widget and the new navigation structure
- Login page with integration to external login providers

name: v0.2.2 - Alpha (beta1 rc1)
body:
This is beta1 release candidate 1.

Changes since 0.2.1:
- The master automatically applies the current release version tag (from the build that generated the binary) to the docker images used for deployers, builders, and other automatically used images.
  - The default image format is `openshift/origin-deployer:${version}`, and can be changed to pull images via another naming scheme through the `--images` tag on `openshift start`.
  - The flag `--latest-images` will substitute `latest` for `${version}` instead of the most recent tag.
- Authentication and authorization policies are now in place, although not enforced.  See the documentation for more
- You can run OpenShift against an existing Kubernetes cluster by specifying the `--kubernetes=<addr>` and `--kubeconfig=<path>` flags - the kubeconfig controls how you authenticate to the cluster.  
  - OpenShift will start a proxy at `/api/` that checks authorization against OpenShift, and then proxies requests to the cluster.
  - This is still an experimental feature
- `openshift kube` now matches the upstream `kubectl` command, and will expose all of the options from upstream and works on OpenShift resources.
  - kubeconfig is respected for both the osc and kubectl commands - see `openshift ex config` to manipulate it
- `osc rollback` will allow you to rollback to a previous version of a deployment config (create a new deployment using previous settings)

name: v0.2.1 - Alpha
body:
This is a nightly release with a few fixes on top of v0.2.1.  

Changes
- OpenShift API is secured with TLS end to end
  - When calling the client command you can use the `.kubeconfig` file generated into `openshift.local.certificates/admin/.kubeconfig`, or use the `root.crt` from Curl
- Add SSL routing support to the router, including termination, SNI load balancing, and passthrough modes
- The `osc` command line is now included in the download zip

Known bugs:
- The `resize` command is temporarily disabled, v0.2.2 will re-add it to the `osc` command

name: v0.2 - Alpha
body:
UPDATED: Fixed an error with the 0.2 release that prevented templates from being created (#594), files now 0.2-20

Important changes in this release:
- API stability guarantee
  - Starting with v0.2, OpenShift promises that APIs will be done with backwards compatibility promises in effect
  - New fields will be added to `v1beta1` without breaking compatibility for older clients
  - Fields will only be removed when new API versions are introduced
  - See http://lists.openshift.redhat.com/openshift-archives/dev/2014-December/msg00028.html for more
- Introduction of the new OpenShift CLI - `openshift cli`
  - Reuses much of the upstream Kubernetes CLI, new commands are being added which will cover OpenShift commands
  - If you symlink `osc` to your `openshift` binary, you can omit the `cli` prefix in the command - `osc get pods`
- API documentation via Swagger
  - See http://lists.openshift.redhat.com/openshift-archives/dev/2014-December/msg00045.html for more
- Continued cleanup, addition of auth support internally, and Kubernetes 0.6
